The Slimmest Body, the Most Spacious Storage per Dollar, and the Earliest to Be Delivered Mini PC on Indiegogo!Hercules Computing is excited to introduce the Hercules PalmTop - the lightest PALM size Windows 10 PC that does not compromise computing power!You can use Hercules PalmTop as a mobile PC and a mini desktop at your home or office. Since it incorporates the same Windows 10 OS (Ubuntu, too) as your home or office PCs with compact palm size, you don't need to spend time and money on mobile version applications anymore!Hercules PalmTop goes into a new category of PC, and you can see its position among other Windows based devices. Please understand the table below is only for comparison, and devices listed work synergistically together.Hercules PalmTop and Other Windows Based DevicesCompact Desktop AND Light Weight Mobile PCWhat You Can Do with Hercules PalmTop
Great Computing Power in a Smart Phone Size Windows 10 PC that Weighs as Little as 1~2 Eggs
Carry it anywhere, anytime, no backpack or computer bag needed – it's all in the palm of your hand.
Yes, it is Palm Size!
Comfortably Fits to a PocketCan Be Set Up in Any Tiny Space!Light Weight - Less than 4 oz., Weighs as much as a Couple of Eggs!
Color Changed!!Current backers voted between black and orange, and black won. Hercules now goes black! This is 3D image for the black color model.Invincible ResourcesIncomparable Core Resources to Other Mobile DevicesRuns desktop applications as nimbly as a full size PC or laptopHercules PalmTop gives you more speed, storage, and efficiency than current high priced tablets and smartphones. Hercules PalmTop runs full functions of Windows OS and its applications in the palm of your hand and at a fraction of the price!NOW, your mobile PC can do the work on a SAME PLATFORM as your Windows desktop in any room in the house or in any remote location.Newest Intel Quad Core Cherry Trail CPU, 12 core GPU, 4G RAM, 64G~128G StoragePowerful enough to run all Windows 10 applications with the strength of the newest Intel mobile CPU, Cherry Trail z8300, and 12 Core GPU, Hercules PalmTop can support graphic rich tasks more fluidly and than most other mobile devices including casual games.Its 4G memory and 64G(or 128G optional) internal storage surpass most mobile computing requirements.Need more storage? NO PROBLEM. Hercules PalmTop is equipped with an SD card port that grows your storage up to 128G, providing for a maximum 256G storage. Of course, you can use USB memory as well.  Fast Connectivity / Noiseless ContructionFast / Convenient ConnectivityTo deliver the fastest mobile computing experience, Hercules PalmTop has integrated the fastest, broadest WiFi module – 802.11ac – making gaming controller response or streaming your favorite movies the fastest available. 802.11ac theoretical speeds versus 802.11n and 802.11g – Forbes

Bluetooth 4.0 is also ready to support all connectable devices to Hercules PalmTop. Hercules PlamTop has great connectivity to conveniently use other peripherals. An HDMI port to connect HD TVs or projectors, 3.5 mm headphone jack, USB 3.0 and 2.0 one of each. USB 3.0 transfers data 10 times faster than USB 2.0.Versatility from Fast / Convenient ConnectorsFanless noiseless constructionHercules PalmTop has self cooling construction to handle the heat from Cherry Trail CPU, and doesn't have a separate fan.Connect with More DevicesAs a Windows 10 PC with the advance connectivity via wifi ac, Hercules PalmTop can be connected and controlled by Android/iOS phones and tablets using remote desktop control applications in the market. This way, you will feel you are turning a smartphone or a tablet into a Windows 10 PC, since you use full desktop version applications i.e. Photoshop or Powerpoint through the phone or the tablet.  Although very possible, using Photoshop on a smartphone as the part of your routine daily job isn't practical at all. Please consider this as an technical example to show how much heavy desktop applications can be used on your mobile devices through Hercules PalmTop for an urgent tasks. A Smartphone Running Desktop Version Powerpoint via Hercules PalmTop iPAD Running Desktop Version Photoshop via Hercules PalmTopDemonstration : iPAD - Photoshop by using a Third-party Remote Desktop ControlDemonstration : iPhone - Photoshop by using a Third-party Remote Desktop ControlSpecificationWho Needs Hercules PalmTop
The Development




The commitment to Hercules PalmTop began in early 2014. Hercules evaluated all available base boards and dropped the idea of stick PCs, because the HDMI connector wasn’t firm enough with all connectors in use.
The chip sets available to the market were changing so rapidly and after Baytrail proved disappointing in both performance, Hercules Computing decided to wait for the sample run of Cherry Trail.
Combinations of integrated connectors were also limitless, but the optimum configuration was brought to the current Hercules PalmTop.



The housing design also had a huge number of possibilities - from square, vertical / horizontal rectangles. Horizontal rectangle had the most stable position when installed on a table with wires, and has become the final design.

Timeline


Team





Hea Yoon Park, Brian Bowen, Daniel Montano, Inkyu Kim from leftHea Yoon Park 
Founder. MBA and has over 4 years of comprehensive experience from R&D to sales - hardware and software.
Brian Bowen
Management Consultant. Operates 4 businesses successfully over 14 years. Believes the success in business comes from the perfect deployment of corporate mission.
Daniel Montano
Marketing director. Market communication expert. Studied design at the Institute of European Studies, Vienna, Austria.
In Kyu Kim
Engineering. Studied mechanical engineering. Experienced coordinator between laboratories and companies.




Risks and challengesAs you see from still photos and videos in the above content, we have real working prototypes with full functionality. Hercules Computing has done the required preliminary research thoroughly enough to make this project safe and continues to pursue manufacturing on a larger scale. From all the experiences, we are very confident to deliver final products to pledgers safe. On top of it, we will keep our whole project transparent.

story:
We are incredibly grateful for your great support we have received! 

The team hopes you enjoy new stretch goal with other colors available.

Magnetic adaptors are nothing new. magtop pro, however, is not JUST an adaptor. Yes, it does make plugging easy, giving you access to the emerging standard for charging and transferring data, and YES it does seamlessly detaches the power cable when it's pulled from its socket, but it is also so much more than that.

We all remember Magsafe, the magnetic charging interface of old Apple MacBook, as a product that combined creativity and utility. However Apple decided to discontinue the magnetic charging function in the subsequent MacBook and replaced it with the Type-C interface.  

The past couple of years seen an entire generation of type-c interface accessories trying to find their place on the market, by attempting and failing to replace Magsafe. Magtop Pro was designed to challenge its competitors by offering a charging and data / video transfer solution with the best tech specs out there.   

 Small. Smart & Safe!  

Sleek, minimalist looks and compact design make magtop the portable accessory you always want around. Metallic finish fits perfectly with the Apple aesthetics featuring both female and male connectors (as does MacBook).

Magtop Pro was design to withstand the wear and tear of daily use. All for your convenience! 

Magnetic connection between the type-C male and the type-C female is very strong, ensuring accurate alignment of the product and stability of power and data transmission during use.  

The adapter consist in total of 20 gold-plated pins, with the outer two pairs being the power pins, and the rest being used as data transfer points. Compared with the other, standard 3 and 5 pin magnetic adapters, the magtop's 20 pin set lets it utilize the full power of the device, while supporting up to 20V/5A power (100W), 4K video and 10Gbps data transmission.   

Magtop Pro is compatible with ALL devices that have a USB-C connector, from smartphones through USB-C Hubs & Docks to the latest Macbooks. Whatever your device may be, we've got you covered!  

Magtop Pro has 3X the functionality of other magnetic connectors, with the unique capability to provide all the USB-C signals required of new peripherals. Not only is the connector rated for up to 100W charging capacity, it also allows up to 4K video/audio and 10GBs data transfer, all while maintaining USB-C reversible connector capability.  

Transfer your data without compromising on the charging speed and charge without compromising on the time of your data transfer. It's easy. It's pro.   

Put names (and faces!) to people bringing you the ultimate charging and data transfer solution.   

From first drafts and design concepts to your doorstep. Track the magtop's journey! 

Every project has its challenges regardless of the scope, however we have done our best to minimize the risks as much as possible. We are not relying on outsourced engineering, we design our products In-House. We're as passionate about design and tech specs as we are about our customer service, so we made sure all the logistics are in place to guarantee you a stress-free, timely delivery.

After getting a fully function prototype, we have been testing magtop pro in its most important features; magnet strength with a success rate of 100%. In terms of charging speed and data transmission after testing it with different devices we proved Magtop pro does not affect it at all. But in case you were still in doubt we throw in an extra 2 years warranty.

story:
Short Summary

The past two years I have developed, hosted and supported AppNet API Console (ANAC) console-app.net, ADN file manager files-app.net, searchadn.net and cloud-app.net mostly out of my own pocket, especially the development of them.

I love to keep on running these services for you. The time has come to ask you, the users of these services for a little help to keep these services alive for the years to come. When succesfully funded I will keep them running for 2 up to 5 years depending on the amount of funds raised and remove all donation. Because this is a flexible campaign I'll try to keep (parts of) these services running for as long as possible if the initial goal of $750 is not reached.

What We Need & What You Get

To keep these four services running for more five years I'm looking for $1500. About $500 will go into server and domain name cost and the rest will be for my work to keep everything running smooth and up-to-date. That breaks down to $100 per year for hosting and domain cost and $200 per year for my time. That's less than $1 per day.

Depending on funds raised I will:

  • keep the services running for 2 years when $750 is raised
  • keep the services running for 3 years when $1000 is raised
  • keep the services running for 4 years when $1250 is raised
  • keep the services running for 5 years when $1500 is raised

Please contact me (@ludolphus) on app.net through PM if you do no want your name on the special thank you page of these services. Also contact me if you do want your name there and want to have a link added (perk levels $10 and up). For perk levels $100 and up please provide address details when asked by indiegogo so I can send you a special thank you gift.

story: .

Short Summary

Hillcrest High School (Midvale, UT, USA) started a robotics program to develop interest in science, technology, engineering, and math. Part of that effort was to create a team to compete in the FIRST Robotics Competition (see usfirst.org). This is an international  high-school level competition.  At our regional event, our rookie team was honored with the Rookie All-Star award for being the rookie team that best exemplified what FIRST is about, including gracious professionalism.  Part of that award was an invitation to the national/world championship in St. Louis, MO.   

What We Need & What You Get

To help get us there, we are trying to raise $25,000 in the short three weeks we have until nationals. We are also looking for long-term goals to be able to establish a permanent presence in our community by building robotics programs at our local middle and elementary schools. We were honored with a start-up grant from NASA and our district, the Canyons School District, but want to develop a self-sustaining program. We are looking both for help to get to nationals and help to start building our future.

We have several sponsorship programs that come with various levels of acknowledgements. The levels are Friend, Associate, Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Diamond. All levels are gratefully appreciated.

The Impact

FIRST robotics in general, and our robotics team specifically, are all about developing skills in students that will serve them in their adult lives.  Part of that is learning all aspects of an engineering project from start to finish.  This means that our team is comprised of engineering, programming, manufacturing, business, marketing, graphics, and media students as well as students from other disciplines.  We seek to engender partnerships with professional engineers and college professors to mentor the team. We seek to mentor other teams and sponsor elementary teams.

This program also seeks to find those students who might not otherwise be exposed to robotics, but for whom this field may prove to be choice.  Our school's demographics are varied by all metrics such as economic or racial diversity.  You could change the course of the life of one such child.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, you may know someone who can.  If you would like to mentor us or help in other ways, send us an email.  Post us on your facebook page so others may help.  THANK YOU!

Website: huskyrobotics.weebly.com

Youtube: Harvey Robotics

Facebook: Husky Robotics

Twitter: @huskyrobotics

email: huskyrobotics1@gmail.com

story:
PowaStack - The World's First Universal Wireless Charger

Say goodbye to cable mess galore. No more need for multiple sockets and cables to charge all your devices.


PowaStack charges:

·  ALL Apple phones and tablets (iPhone, iPod, iPad, Apple Watch - all models) 

·  ALL Android phones and tablets (Samsung, HTC, LG, etc.)  

·  ALL Wireless headphones (Beats by Dre, etc.) 

·  Apple, Samsung smart watches (Other brands supported)

PowaStack is the last charger you will ever need - seriously! 

Are you someone who waits for one device to finish charging before you can start the other? Not anymore. 

You love your Apple device, but wait what about the Kindle E-reader and the Beats headphones? Well, now you don’t need to stress over which one gets charged first, as you can charge up to 5 devices from different brands - without interrupting or waiting for a device to be charged. 

You can customize PowaStack to charge a mixture of devices and brands all at the same time. 

Wondering if your device is compatible?


We looked at every possible combination of smart phones and tablets and used this research as the basis for creating PowaStack.  Apple, Samsung, Motorola, Windows Mobile, HTC, Blackberry, LG, Sony, Nokia, the list goes on. Whether you love iOS or Android, PowaStack has you covered! 

It truly is the World’s First Universal Charger.

No longer do your devices have to be piled up in an unsightly mess on the floor or table around your multi socket extension leads.

 PowaStack provides a stylish home for all your mobile devices.

Keep all your gadgets in one tidy place

PowaStack - is not only a complete docking and charging station it also has a portable smart charger that identifies your mobile device and provides optimal fast charging. How cool is that!

PowaStack Smart Charger

What we have to offer

We truly believe we have a great and innovative product that you will love. It is not only an attractive device, but practical for reducing wire clutter and the need for multiple device chargers. It is also a great space saver, the ultimate gadget organizer. If that wasn't enough, well you'll love it's fast charging capability. It's the only device we know that is purposely designed to support the widest range of mobile devices.


Whether you are conservative or you like a little flare we think you will agree that we have combined practical with our beautiful "S" shape design. Our flagship high gloss finish comes in Red/Black and all Black.

PowaStack Red & Black

PowaStack Black

PowaStack Aluminium

For those of you who like the first class treatment then our premium models are just for you. So we chose the best materials and best finishes. Made from machined aluminium, the PowaStack looks amazing. Notice the crisp lines with a satin finish in our anodized aluminium range.

PowaStack Aluminium

Anodizing chemically creates a hardened surface on aluminium while allowing its natural beauty to shine through. This creates a look that just cannot be matched with paint. This process is used in today's top electronic devices like MacBooks, iPhones, iPads and many other high-end laptops and tablets. Clear anodizing creates a finish that is Silver in colour, a perfect compliment to your premium brand mobile devices.

Securely Planted  


When designing PowaStack we were not only looking at practicality, functionality and beauty but also stability. With devices getting taller we wanted to ensure that your device would be securely planted. That's why we designed the base to use micro-suction pads that sticks to almost any surface and holds on tight. You won't need to worry about your tablet falling over whilst charging. Best of all, you can pick up PowaStack and move it to another location without leaving any residue behind.

What’s Included with PowaStack

Choice Of:-

1 x iPhone 4 connector

1 x iPhone 5/6 connector

1 x micro USB connector (Android devices)

1 x Micro USB Headphone connector

1 x USB - C connector

1 x Micro USB watch connector

You can choose up to 5 connectors for the devices you have.

Note: The iWatch cable charger is not included, as we have designed PowaStack to use your existing  one

Help us make it happen and make a pledge now.

All we need now is your support. With your help we can make this happen!  

Please make a pledge now and help us fund the campaign. In return we have a number of great perks for each of your pledges.

Thank you!


PowaStack Timeline


Team

Inventor and Entrepreneur with over 20 years of business and property development experience.


CAD Designer and Technical Engineer with 7 years’ experience in the design and product development industry.

Together as a team, Patrick and Michael both combine the design, engineering and execution of their talents that makes them uniquely qualified to deliver on a project such as.

How the Funds will be used  

The funds raised will go towards tooling, purchasing of raw materials, production and shipping. We have finalized the design, qualified and selected our manufacturer. Production will begin in January 2016.

Once all backers have received delivery of their pledged rewards and all operational expenses have been deducted, we will be offering a donation to the charity Compassion. This will not affect our ability to delivery PowaStack to all our backers as we simply believe that by helping us bring PowaStack to life, in return, we too will be able to help others in need. 

The charity Compassion provides antenatal care for vulnerable mothers, ensure children are vaccinated against deadly diseases and give mothers the skills they need to earn a living. They provide safe drinking water for children, distribute malaria nets, fund life-saving surgery, set up programs to prevent malnutrition and provide emergency relief after a disaster.

Risks and challenges

As a former property developer running a property company, I know what it takes to deliver a great product on time. Having spent months designing, testing and refining the design, we have already selected the manufacturer to produce our product. The samples you see in the photos and videos work and look fantastic, so we won't need to waste time tweaking the design.

However, every project carries with it certain risks. The most common risks are potential delays in tooling, obtaining raw materials, packaging and shipping. Whilst we are of the opinion that we have reduced these variables as much as possible, they can never be completely eliminated.

We feel our experience and familiarity with our manufacturer and their expertise in the product development process gives us total confidence in handling any unexpected problems. Most importantly, we will make sure to give frequent updates about progress so you'll always be informed about the status of the project. We think you'll find our transparency to be a breath of fresh air.

We would like to thank you in advance for helping PowaStack come to life.

Help us make it happen and select a perk now.

simply believe that by helping us bring PowaStack to life, in return, we too
will be able to help others in need. 


The 
charity Compassion provides antenatal care for vulnerable mothers, ensure children are
vaccinated against deadly diseases and give mothers the skills they need to
earn a living. They provide safe drinking water for children, distribute
malaria nets, fund life-saving surgery, set up programs to prevent malnutrition
and provide emergency relief after a disaster.
Risks
and challenges
As a former property developer
running a property company, I know what it takes to deliver a great product on
time. Having spent months designing, testing and refining the design, we have
already selected the manufacturer to produce our product. The samples you see
in the photos and videos work and look fantastic, so we won't need to waste
time tweaking the design.
However, every project carries with
it certain risks. The most common risks are potential delays in tooling,
obtaining raw materials, packaging and shipping. Whilst we are of the opinion
that we have reduced these variables as much as possible, they can never be
completely eliminated.
We feel our experience and
familiarity with our manufacturer and their expertise in the product
development process gives us total confidence in handling any unexpected problems.
Most importantly, we will make sure to give frequent updates about progress so
you'll always be informed about the status of the project. We think you'll find
our transparency to be a breath of fresh air.
We would like to thank you in advance
for helping PowaStack come to life.Help us make it happen and select a perk now.

story:
Let’s face it. Most of us are glued to our phones. And there are times when you need to use your eyes for something else – like driving, exercising or even walking. 

O6 is an entirely new way to stay connected to your phone without looking at or touching the screen. O6 connects seamlessly via Bluetooth to any iPhone or iPad, allowing users to browse, operate and toggle between virtually any app at the touch of a finger and completely eyes free. Use touch, voice, and gestures to control any app and listen and respond to messages (texts, emails) and social posts, answer/make phone calls, get navigation directions and more at your own pace and in real-time. Using O6 is as simple as listening to the radio. Consider this the most personal radio station that you have ever listened to.

News

Awards: 2017 CES Innovation Award, 2017 Red Dot Product Design Award

ABC 7 News: Video demonstration of O6 combating distracted driving.

Slashgear: "O6's magic comes in two parts. The hardware is deceptive in its simplicity and size... The other half, the software, is just as important"

Gizmag: "Studies have shown how our "sixth sense" fails while texting and that using a HUD (heads-up display) may not provide the intended safety. O6 addresses the common risks of distracted driving..."

CNET Japan, Stuff, ApolloBox

The O6 story

O6 was created to address the risks associated with distracted driving and careless commuting (yes, we coined that term), as well as the accessibility challenges of the visually impaired. O6 represents an entirely new paradigm of device input and control, combining both hardware and software to power a far more accurate and responsive experience than voice-command based interfaces.

By backing O6, you will receive not only one of the first O6s to be shipped at a steep discount from retail price, but also become a collaborator of this project.  

Your O6, your way

Stay safe and productive while driving or commuting

If you’re someone who commutes to work (either by car, train, motorcycle, bicycle, skateboard, or walking), O6 is the smartest way to remain connected and productive while on the go. Your eyes stay focused on the task at hand while the O6 lets you see with your hands.

To make responding even easier, O6 offers context-sensitive actions. O6 automatically analyzes the content and context of your messages then presents you with your most likely response options - allowing you to communicate with just the touch of a button.

 

While exercising

Have you tried to run with your phone? You’re in a good groove and you want to switch songs, get a call or you hear the familiar ping of an email. Instantly, your speed and gait has changed. You’re fumbling for your phone and trying to run while looking down at your phone. With O6, you stay in the zone with no interruptions.

At Home

Use O6 to control your Music and Speakers, without looking at your phone or touching a screen.

 

Failing vision or blind

Fingertips Labs’ mission is to make smart phones accessible to everyone in every context, including the visually impaired and blind. O6 provides the visually impaired a very simple interface to start using mobile applications, and an intuitive and powerful interface to access mobile applications during mobility in conjunction with a cane or blind dog.

In this video, we captured the candid reactions of first use of O6 by experts, including Matt King, who works on an Artificial Intelligence-powered tool for Facebook, and also Facebook's first blind engineer, trying out O6 with his Facebook and Facebook Messenger apps. Please note that these users used Advanced mode with a significantly higher speech rate.

Features

Turn your inbox into radio stations. Scroll & hear your social feeds, text messages, news articles, and more

 

Remotely control and listen to Spotify, Pandora, Apple Music, Podcasts, YouTube, Netflix and more!

Take pictures and phone calls hands free

Respond to messages, get directions on the go

 

Features at a glance

Iconic design

O6 features a beautiful all-metal, tactile, rotary bezel dial, textured touchpad buttons, motion-sensors, and artificial intelligence to bring up the most relevant, contextual information, and actions. The moment you hold the O6 in your hand, you’ll notice the quality and care that has gone into making this product. It balances stunning design with intuitive function to allow complete non-visual and even one-handed control.

O6’s rotary command dial is a feat of engineering. The hallmark of O6 is its orientation-independent design that lets you operate the rotary-command dial or any button without the need to orient the device. Our patent-pending mechanical architecture enables the rotary dial to double up as a tactile button, supporting single-click, double-click, triple-click and press & hold. The dial features tactile ridges to facilitate single-finger operation. The miniaturized architecture results in an ultra-light design weighing less than 10 gm.

The O6 eyes free experience

O6 was built from the ground up by reimagining the design and interaction of all mobile applications for a completely eyes free experience. O6 represents an entirely new paradigm of device input and control, combining both hardware and software to power a far more accurate and responsive experience than voice command-based programs.

How is O6 different from Voice Command interfaces such as Apple Siri, Google Now, or Amazon Echo? The primary purpose of O6 is not to quickly answer questions or set timers. It is to do the type of complex interaction and browsing that we now do every single day with our phones. On average, iPhone users open their phones 80 times a day. This is not generally to look up specific questions or set a timer. We open our phones to check-in, on email or social media, and interact with those applications. This is the problem that O6 solves. Please read our Blogs below on the problems of voice commands and how O6 is different.

Blog 1: The Dangers of Voice Commands: What Apple Siri, Google Now, and Car Companies are Missing.

Blog 2: Your Smartphone Drains More Than Just its Battery.

Blog 3: Why We Don't Listen?

O6 goes wherever you go

Your day takes you in hundred directions – you deserve a device that is as versatile as you are. The O6 product line includes a selection of easily interchangeable accessories that allow the O6 to be mounted on a steering wheel, worn on the wrist or clipped to a pocket or belt. It facilitates single-handed – or even single-fingered – operation so it can be used while mounted in an accessory, lying on a flat surface or simply grasped in the hand.

Accessories include a magnetic steering wheel mount, a suede-brown or white wrist band, a clip mount, as well as an extra charger with reusable double-sided adhesive for mounting on the wall or refrigerator.

Always fresh

Wirelessly update O6 with the latest software using your O6 app.

Developers

O6 provides an open-API platform to send and receive data and commands to its sensors and actuators. Open Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) APIs along with reference iOS code will be provided to integrate O6 directly with your apps or devices such as VR Headsets, Home automation controls, Toys, Car, among others. O6's open-APIs are only visible (exposed) to those devices that first pair with O6. O6’s APIs are not visible during standard advertising.

O6's APIs are exposed as custom BLE services such as Tactile State Service, Accelerometer Service, Haptic service and more, each with an unique Service and Characteristic UUIDs. The haptic motor can play a series of up to 8 distinct waveforms or time delays accessible through APIs to play complex and rich haptic effects in real time. O6 supports a library of 123 Haptic efforts, and complex haptic effects can be easily generated by combining waverforms that can be triggered in real-time. Documentation for developers will be provided during shipment of O6.

Device tech specs

  • Supports over 30 international languages 
  • Size: 40 mm diameter and 11 mm thickness 
  • Weight: Under 10 gm 
  • Battery: Rechargeable battery with charge lifespan of 7-10 days 
  • Compatibility: Works with iPhones, iPads, iPod Touch, version iOS6+ 
  • Bluetooth 4.0 LE Smart
  • Remotely Activate Voice commands 
  • Anodized bead-blasted Aluminum 
  • Haptic (vibration) motor that can play over 200 dynamically selectable haptic effects 
  • Ultra low-power, high performance three axes linear accelerometer 
  • Neodymium magnets with 6kg Holding Force 
  • Splash and water resistant, but not waterproof; can be used in light rain but not recommended to submerge in water 
  • Compatible with any headphones, earbuds, Bluetooth headsets, Bluetooth speakers, and car audio systems Accessories & colors to suit personal styles

Prototypes and timeline

We have spent over 2 years building our prototypes, and now are ready to take the next step to mass-manufacture O6 and bring them to you. We have working prototypes and a manufacturing partner lined up to help us make O6. Our target is to ship O6 by May 2017.

April 2017 - Start of Production to build 3000 units.

We will also be adding exciting new software features to O6, including cloud-based hi-fidelity text-to-speech narration and hyperlink resolution. Backers will be able to vote and choose the priority of adding new content feeds as channels, such as Slack, Yelp, Reddit, Medium, Pocket, Instapaper, Documents, Wordpress, Tumblr, Facebook, Evernote, LinkedIn, or any of your other favorite websites and apps. And if your content includes hyperlinks, the app will automatically fetch and extract the content to audio or convert it to speech for a seamless experience.The possibilities are endless so we will focus on the most important features and on delivering O6 on time.

Team

During the past two years, O6 has had the great fortune of being supported by many individuals and teams who have selflessly contributed to this product and cause. Thank you to everyone that donated their time, ideas and resources to help us make O6 a reality. Our core team is as follows:

Ben Park, Ph.D., Co-founder and CTO, received his Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from Stanford University. Prior to Fingertips Lab, Ben was the CTO and co-founder of a medical device startup called Fluid Medical, which was acquired. In Fluid Medical, Ben Park was instrumental in the creation and development of intravascular ultrasound devices. He brings his expertise in micro-size electromechanical design and manufacturing, and business development to the creation of O6.

P.K. Mishra, Co-founder and CEO, received his MBA from University of Michigan and M.Sc. in Computer Science from the University of Pennsylvania. Prior to Fingertips Lab, P.K. Mishra worked in car companies in the U.S. and Europe for over 10 years in various roles including R&D and Product Development. His focus is on EE, Firmware, Machine Learning, as well as Marketing.

Alex Woolf, Co-founder, received his Masters in Information from the University of Michigan. Prior to Fingertips Lab, Alex worked in leading roles in startups such as Speakeasy, Klamr, Couchsurfing, and also founded his own firm called Kite Hill Studio, which launched the transit commuting app Commutist. Alex brings his expertise in mobile app software development and software design into O6.

 

 

 

FAQ

1. How do I connect my O6 to the iPhone?

O6 connects to your iPhone via Bluetooth. After charging O6, please press any button on O6 and O6 will show up as "Pair with O6" under Bluetooth Setting. Tap on the prompt "Pair with O6" to connect and you are all set.

2. Does O6 support Android?

O6 currently only supports only iOS (eg iPhone, iPad, iPod) devices. Android is still in the works so please stay tuned.

FAQ
1. How do I connect my O6 to the iPhone?
O6 connects to your iPhone via Bluetooth. After charging O6, please press any button on O6 and O6 will show up as "Pair with O6" under Bluetooth Setting. Tap on the prompt "Pair with O6" to connect and you are all set.
2. Does O6 support Android?
O6 currently only supports only iOS (eg iPhone, iPad, iPod) devices. Android is still in the works so please stay tuned.
3. What languages does O6 support?
O6 currently supports 27 languages.
The supported languages are as follows: Arabic, Chinese, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, and Turkish.
4. How is O6 different from Apple Siri or other Voice Command Systems?
The primary purpose of O6 is not to quickly answer questions or set timers. It is to do with the the complex interactions and browsing that we now do every single day with our phones. On average, iPhone users open their phones 80 times a day. This is not generally to look up specific questions or set a timer. We open our phones to check-in, on email or social media. This is the problem O6 solves. O6 is far more reliable, interactive, and usable than Voice Command Systems can ever be.
5. Does O6 have a speaker?
No, the O6 does not have a speaker. O6 app stream audio via Bluetooth to Bluetooth speakers, Bluetooth earbuds, and car audio systems.
6. What is the Battery Life on the O6?
O6 typically lasts 5-7 days on normal use.
7. Where can I use O6?
You can use O6 while driving, outdoors or while walking or running, or at home.
8. How is O6 eyes free when the video shows the app while driving?
We show the app in the video to demonstrate the connection between the O6 device and the app. In practice, we expect the driver to use the app without looking because of speech feedback. The app works in the background and even when the phone is locked.
9. My question is not answered here. Where can I write to get my question answered?
You can reach us at hello@fingertipslab.com if you have a question.

story:
Robohand was established in 2011 when Richard van As had a woodworking accident and lost 4 fingers on his right hand. He is right handed.

During his very short time in the hospital he decided he would create himself a mechanical finger to replace his lost digits.

After researching prosthetcs it was apparent there was nothing available to replace his lost fingers and companies that were experimenting with finger prosthetics wanted exhorbitent amounts of money.

Richard then began his journey of developing his own finger. It all started in his garage with bits and pieces and many trips to the hardware store.

During his year long struggle and many prototypes later, he engaged with another gentleman in the USA and they collaborated together. They were donated two MakerBot Replicator 2 3D printers to assist with prototyping.

Things took off and soon Richard had finalised his Robofinger and created a mechanical hand. Between SA and the USA the file was scripted and the first Robohand was printed in 3D in SA!

The first hand was fitted to a 5 year old boy Liam who has come leaps and bounds with using his Robohand. This was done for free. Robohand has helped 4 children in total in South Africa with Robohands but we have run out of funding to continue to provide this device for free.

If you follow our Facebook page or our Blog you will be enthralled by the stories of the children that are now able to use BOTH of their hands.

Your funding will supply the necessary materials, like Orthoplastic/Thermoplastic, hardware for putting the hands together (nuts, bolts, bungi cord), rolls of PLA plastic for the 3D printer to print the actual hands, plastidip for the fingers, anodizing materials (like sulphuric acid, desmutting liquid, colourant/dye and distilled water) the time and committment from Rich to create these hands.

Robohand has been nominated for the Rockafella Innovators award as well as been given an opportunity to create a display in the Science Museum of London.

Your contribution will help aid the continuation of this project:

  • Initially to keep us going we are aiming to reach a goal of $10,000.
  • This is a humanitarian project and we are working on a "pay it forward" method.
  • We have been requested to present Robohand at Congress at the end of 2013 and your funding will help get us there.

The idea of Robohand is "Open Source" and the file is available for download from Thingiverse.com. Visit our blog at www.robohand.blogspot.com for more information or follow our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Robohand/260864887366912?ref=hl

Please share our story with your friends and family. Robofinger and Robohand are not only available to SA, but all over the world.

Please also use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Problem

Rooting an Android device will unlock its full potential.  SuperOneClick provides an easy solution, but struggles in a few key areas:

  • Cross-Platform Availability

SuperOneClick is essentialy Windows-only. While it is possible to run on Mac or Linux, installing and configuring the Mono libraries can be a hassle.

  • Download Size

SuperOneClick's download will take a while to complete on a slow connection. Downloading and installing the Mono libraries will increase this time.

  • Source Code

The source code for SuperOneClick is unavailable. Because of this, a user can never fully trust it.

The Solution

The Cross-Platform Android Rooter Project aims to create a Cross-Platform, Open-Source Android rooting solution to address these problems. It will be available for Windows, Mac, and Linux. It's modular design will allow for smaller download sizes of only the files you need at the time. The full source code will be released under GPLv2+.

Your Contribution

Your contribution will help fund the purchase of hardware for this project.

Your Perks

You're contributing, of course there will be perks!

  • Pre-Release Previews

You'll get Pre-Alpha, Alpha, Beta, and Final release software a week before it's released to the general pubic.

  • Support

Having problems using this software to root your device? You'll get free support rooting your Android devices for 2 months after the Final release if you contribute at least $20.

To Wrap Up

The Cross-Platform Android Rooter Project aims to create a rooting solution which is:

  • Cross-Platform
  • Modular and
  • Open Source

Can't Contribute?

That's okay. You can also help by:

  • Spreading the word around. Tell others about this project.
  • Volunteering. More developers and testers are always needed.
story_txt:
The Problem
Rooting an Android device will unlock its full potential.  SuperOneClick provides an easy solution, but struggles in a few key areas:


Cross-Platform Availability


SuperOneClick is essentialy Windows-only. While it is possible to run on Mac or Linux, installing and configuring the Mono libraries can be a hassle.

Download Size

SuperOneClick's download will take a while to complete on a slow connection. Downloading and installing the Mono libraries will increase this time.

Source Code

The source code for SuperOneClick is unavailable. Because of this, a user can never fully trust it.
The Solution
The Cross-Platform Android Rooter Project aims to create a Cross-Platform, Open-Source Android rooting solution to address these problems. It will be available for Windows, Mac, and Linux. It's modular design will allow for smaller download sizes of only the files you need at the time. The full source code will be released under GPLv2+.


Your Contribution
Your contribution will help fund the purchase of hardware for this project.
Your Perks
You're contributing, of course there will be perks!

Pre-Release Previews

You'll get Pre-Alpha, Alpha, Beta, and Final release software a week before it's released to the general pubic.

Support

Having problems using this software to root your device? You'll get free support rooting your Android devices for 2 months after the Final release if you contribute at least $20.


To Wrap Up
The Cross-Platform Android Rooter Project aims to create a rooting solution which is:

Cross-Platform
Modular and
Open Source



Can't Contribute?
That's okay. You can also help by:

Spreading the word around. Tell others about this project.
Volunteering. More developers and testers are always needed.

story:
Our Story

Alcoholipedia.com is your online Libation Information Station! We have thousands of pages covering just about anything and everything related to alcohol. Some of the categories on our site include: Drinking Games, Drink Recipes, Liquor and DUI Laws, Alcohol Quotes, Alcohol Facts, Hangover Cures, and even a map of every brewpub and brewery in the entire United States! Most of these categories have at least 100 entries and some have over 1000. The site is filled with everything you have ever wanted to know about booze, and even some stuff you probably didn't want to know. We have begun developing the most important portion of the site, the mobile app. Once this is complete you can access all of this information and more for free while you are out at the bar, or a wedding, or a football game, or wherever! We are a 100% wind powered and employee owned company and everything we do for you and the rest of the world is and will always be FREE!

The Impact

The project you will be funding is our Blood Alcohol Content Calculator Mobile App. There are other BAC Apps on the market but ours is different, and dare we say.... better! Our proprietary formula for determining BAC along with our innovative methods and groundbreaking databases make our BAC Calculator the most accurate, fun, easy to use, and easy to integrate BAC Calculator in the world today. The possibilities are endless! And we have big plans for the calculator and for our contributors once we are fully online.


What We Need & What You Get

The code for our project does not currently exist. There is nothing remotely close to this on the market today. We have the best app, database, and website programmers in the world lined up and ready to make this totally awesome dream become a totally awesome reality. All we need is your support! Just so you know the specifics; 30K goes toward app development and design, 15K to database and website integration and compatibility coding, and the 5K will go to cover fees and to help pay for all of your awesome perks! Once the app is operational the basic version will be free to the world but will contain advertisements. The ad free premium version will cost a little money. But its important to note that all of you who contribute more than $10 will receive full access to the most advanced version of the app in addition to the other perks listed below. You will also have full access to the first versions of the app before it is released into the hot hands of the world. So grab a bottle o' rum and hop on board with us. I promise that you will be glad that you did.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out our website! This is the next big thing and you are able to view it and use it pre launch! We have done zero advertising, and zero marketing in for the site thus far. You are among the first to be able to view and use the site. Enjoy it! Once the mobile app is finished we will begin advertising and opening up Alcoholipedia to the rest of the world. And then its off to the races. In the meantime please tell your friends and family about the site and the BAC Calculator app and please let us know what we can do better. We are here for you and we want your experience with our products to be absolutely second to none.

story: My computer has died. And you would think being an actor you would have a lot of money. The problem is that sometimes as an actor you have years where you don't work. This is that year. Unfortunately to work I need a computer to submit myself for auditions and also do auditions from my house for voice work. And as a photographer I need a computer because I need to be able to edit and send my photos. I have been lucky to have friends who have let me borrow their computers but I really need my own because they are not always available. I hate to ask people for money but I wouldn't be asking if I really didn't need it. I work 2 other jobs at Gamestop and at a Rock climbing gym. I also go to school and I am in an unpaid internship at a recording studio. Unfortunately my other two jobs don't even cover the bills I already have. Please help me acquire the equipment I need for my dream jobs.

story:
This campaign has ended.
Lumenator is available here.

LumaBlast & LumaBlast DUO (dual color)

18000 Lumen (1K) Video and Photo LED Panel

Photo. Video. Go. Anywhere. Do. Anything. LED. LIGHT.

LumaBlast has 50% more Power than Lumenaire, 3x the Power of Power Panel, and 6x the Power of Lumenator.

This is our BRAND NEW premium model. It follows our highly successful Lumenaire and power panel campaigns on Indiegogo. 

LumaBlast comes in two models:

LumaBlast $849 (Early Bird! Pricing)

Product Highlights:

Daylight Color (5600K)

18,000 Lumens (>1K) of Overall Power (Over 1000W tungsten equivalent)

Super Thin at just over 1"

Super Light at just over 4 pounds

Built-in Softbox (LEDNatural technology) for ultra portability

Included Rechargeable Battery and AC Adapter for Studio Use

Tungsten, Cool, RingLight and Spotlight Attachments

Fits on any Standard Tripod Mount (1/4" 20)

Flexible Ball Head Mount (1/4" 20)

LumaBlast DUO $899 (Early Bird! Pricing)

Product Highlights:

Dual Color Model (3200K Tungsten- 5600K Daylight)

18,000 Lumens (>1K) of Overall Power (Over 1000W tungsten equivalent)

Super Thin at just over 1"

Super Light at just over 2 pounds

Built-in Softbox (LEDNatural technology) for ultra portability

Included Rechargeable Battery and AC Adapter for Studio Use

Tungsten, Cool, RingLight and Spotlight Attachments

Fits on any Standard Tripod Mount (1/4" 20)

Flexible Ball Head Mount (1/4" 20)


LumaBlast Essentials Kit $125
The Lumenaire Essentials Kit includes everything you need to round out your Lumenaire:
  - 1x Protective Cushioned and Water-Resistant Zipper Case
  - Upgrade to Heavy Duty Tripod BallHead Mount
  - Upgrade to 9800mah Battery for 1.5+ hour run-time (instead of the default 6800mah battery / 1+ hour run-time). Run-time varies based on power setting. 1.5+ hour run-time estimate is at full power.

LumaBlast is also available at a special bundle price for multi-light and multi-accessory kits (2x, 3x, etc.).

Please make your perk choice on the right.

Shipping:

U.S. Shipping: $49 Flat Rate Priority Mail Shipping

International Shipping: $89 Flat Rate First Class International Mail

Note to International Customers: We will supply you with the correct plug for your respective region when ordering. We carry plugs for US, UK, EU and AU.

The Go Anywhere, Do Anything LED light at a price you won't believe!


Thanks for checking out our LumaBlast project! Here at ColorRight, we've been making awesome white balance tools and flash diffusers for over 5 years. We've even won awards for our ColorRight PRO line of color balance tools. 

Now, we want to introduce you to the LumaBlast. Recently, we raised over $67K on Lumenaire, almost $60K for our first Power Panel campaign and over $40K on oursecond Power Panel campaign. 

So far, we have made a working prototype of this revolutionary type of LED panel light that works for both photo and Video. The LumaBlast LED light is an ultra thin LED panel (1 inch) that has mountains of power (approximately 18,000 lumens, 1000+ Watt Light Bulb). LumaBlast also uses our LEDNatural technology for ultra soft light without the hassle of a softbox. At just over 5 pounds this panel is your Go Anywhere, Do Anything lighting solution. 


The LumaBlast is amazing, but we need your help to make it a reality. We are leveraging a lot of the technology and knowledge we gained from our earlier Lumenaire and Power Panel projects in the LumaBlast, so we don't need to raise as much money to make the LumaBlast a reality, but we still need lots of help! We are still a small family run company, even with the 3 new staff we've added. We believe these LEDNatural LED products are the best we have ever made.

Your Impact & Our Future Plans

We think LumaBlast, Lumenaire, Power Panel and Lumenator are the future of photo & video lighting. By contributing you are making a difference in the lives of photographers and videographers everywhere. The LumaBlast, Lumenaire, Power Panel and Lumenator projects have the potential to totally up-end all our pre-conceived notions about what LED lighting can do, and where it can go. With the success of LumaBlast, Lumenaire, Power Panel and Lumenator we plan to introduce even more products utilizing our LEDNatural technology.

We believe the LumaBlast, Lumenaire, Power Panel and Lumenator represent the first products in a true 2nd wave of LED lighting technology. We can't wait to see where you take the LumaBlast or what you do with it once you get there.

We can't get there without you. Please help us get the word out, by telling your family and friends and through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc. This site has convenient links for most social sites right here on this page.

Thank you so much for supporting the future of photo and video lighting with your contribution!

Please choose your perk using the links to the right.

Lumen FAQ:

Q: How do you measure lumens? I see all of your products range quite high but most companies measure at the light source (1mm away)...so how to compare with working distance?

A: Lumens are a measure of total light output, not the light intensity at a specific distance. We are reporting the total amount of light output from the LEDs themselves, inside the light chamber, prior to the diffusion technology.

If you buy an LED light bulb in any regular store you will see a Lumens rating (not lux). We think this is the best rating method to use for our lights because it is the most common, and is the best understood by the average consumer. If you know how bright a "60 watt" 800 Lumen LED bulb you bought at Wal-Mart is, you can probably make a reasonable inference about a higher Lumen rating.

You are probably seeing some other LED manufacturers use a Lux measurement which needs to include a specific distance. Lux more or less tells you how intense a light beam is at a specific point, at a specific distance. I'm not sure why some manufacturers use this measurement, but it doesn't really tell you a lot. A very narrow beam of light (e.g., a flashlight could have a very high lux, but low lumens). I highly doubt you would want to use a flashlight to light your subject though.

One of the reasons our LEDNatural technology is so special is precisely because our technology has a 120 degree coverage area, whereas, most traditional LED panels only have a 60 degree coverage area. In this scenario, a 60 degree LED light panel could conceivably measure higher on a Lux reading than a panel with a 120 degree area of coverage, but actually put out less light (Lumens). Hope some of this makes sense.

In short, its apples to oranges. We choose to report the more common measure of LED brightness.

story:
What is Huugga?

Huugga is a new way to search and find with 3 clicks or taps.

Huugga is a touch interface for search engines.


        What are the advantages & benefits?

        • Accelerates the searches on PCs, Macs, Android and iOS!
        • Provides quick access to the latest hot topics!
        • Simplifies comparisons between the hottest!
        • Makes searches more fun!


        How Huugga works?

        Here's an example. Suppose you are looking for Angelina Jolie*. With a tradicional search you´ll have to type 15 times (13 letters, an space and the Enter key). 

        *: Angelina Jolie has been at the top of searches during 70 months.

        With Huugga you only need         3 clicks on your PC/Mac or 3 taps on your mobile device. Easier! Faster! Huugga!

        That means: "With Huugga you skip the traditional search interface"

        Why Huugga?


        How we will invest the funds raised

        A global development like Huugga has to face issues such as:

        • Expand the Team
        • Fast servers for Huugga website
        • Marketing, testing and online promotion tools
        • Translations, accounting, paperwork and legal issues


        Goals and Languages 

        If total funds raised reach 25,000 USD: we will develop the English version.
        It will be available for Web and Android.

        If total funds raised reach 45,000 USD: we will extend the English version to iOS. Also we will develop the Spanish version. It will be available for Web, Android and iOS.

        If total funds raised reach 65,000 USD: we will develop the German version.
        It will be available for Web, Android and iOS.

        If total funds raised reach 85,000 USD: we will develop the French version. 
        It will be available for Web, Android and iOS. 


        Answers to most likely questions:

        What Huugga mean?

        • We decided on the name after a long process of finding a name that was meaningful, short and easy to remember. 
        • In english, Huugga has a visual kinship with Huge (time saver). We think that: "If Huugga is used worldwide, together we can save millions of minutes around the world. These minutes without Huugga are spent daily searching." 
        • In spanish, Huugga has a phonetic relationship to spanish word: Juega (Play in English). We like this phonetic similarity because  because Huugga will use gamification techniques to make the search process more fun.
        • For us, Huugga is synonymous with Hottest guide (about seaches). Because it allows quick access to frequently historical research and the hottest searches of the day or week.


        For years, big tech companies have tried to reach Google and they didn´t have success. Why do you think that happened?
        • We have researched a lot about this topic and we detected 5 important reasons. The main reason is that: 

        • "They have been doing the same as Google, in the same way as Google"

        • Conclusion: "To be different you need to make something different"

        What are the areas where it is possible to innovate in Search Engines World? 
        There are 4 important areas:
        1. Search Interface:  The way how users get in touch with the search engine. The search interfaces are based on a box where we type texts. That system is slow, borry and uncomfortable for the 2 billion users of phones and tablets.
        2. WebBot: The software that inspects websites in the Web. Improve this area requires a lot of investment, resources and time. Google and Microsoft have been investing billions here. 
        3. Rankings: The way in which results are ordered and displayed. Again, the major search engines, shows the results in the same way.
        4. Business Model: The way that advertising is shown on the web and on mobile devices. And again, there is little innovation here, everyone does it in a very similar way.

        Has Huugga plans to innovate in these 4 areas?
        • We have plans to innovate in 3 of these 4 areas. But now we need to focus on the search interface. 
        • With Huugga the above diagram will be as follows:


        Why do you focus on search interface?
        Because now there are 2 Billion people with smartphones or tablets around the World.  All these people have several years of experience using icon-based touch interfaces. But when they need to search for information they are forced to return to the alphanumeric keypad.



        Huugga looks like a game. It is? 

        • Yes! Huugga will use Gamification techniques. For example:  While you are looking for information you accumulate points, as in a game. Also, there will be levels to overcome, as in a game.

        • Also you can collect badges as you play, as in a game.  Thus, the search process will be more fun and more enjoyable.

        • By it self, it can make "the difference"
        Is there another way to make it happen?
        Yes, there is. You can share this information with your friends, contacts and followers using social buttons, which are at the top of this page.
        Thanks!

We have plans to innovate in 3 of these 4 areas. But now we need to focus on the search interface. 


With Huugga the above diagram will be as follows:









Why do you focus on search interface?Because now there are 2 Billion people with smartphones or tablets around the World.  All these people have several years of experience using icon-based touch interfaces. But when they need to search for information they are forced to return to the alphanumeric keypad.




Huugga looks like a game. It is? 


Yes! Huugga will use Gamification techniques. For example:  While you are looking for information you accumulate points, as in a game. Also, there will be levels to overcome, as in a game.






Also you can collect badges as you play, as in a game.  Thus, the search process will be more fun and more enjoyable.



By it self, it can make "the difference"








Is there another way to make it happen?Yes, there is. You can share this information with your friends, contacts and followers using social buttons, which are at the top of this page.

Thanks!

story:
BallReady is an automatic food dispenser and ball launcher. BallReady is a novel way to play fetch with your dog that also promotes activity while you are away. Make sure that your dog is exercising and eating properly with BallReady! 

Dogs rely on their owners for exercise and food. Leaving your dog alone and un-stimulated for long periods of time can place them under immense stress. Lack of exercise has been linked to unhealthy weight gain, separation anxiety and more serious health problems. Ensure your dog is leading a healthy and fulfilled life. 




BallReady is an IT convergence product that combines a ball launcher and a food dispenser. These two were combined to create a Pavlovian response where your dog will associate playing fetch with treats. By creating this association, your dog will learn to love playing fetch even when there is no reward thereby promoting activity.  Although there is no beating spending quality time with their owners, BallReady will keep your dog active and stimulated even when you are away. 




CONTROL FOOD RELEASE AMOUNT
Through a knob on the back you can control how much food is released. Amount can be controlled to match your dog's feeding needs. The food dispenser can also be turned off to allow for play time without treats.

INDOOR/OUTDOOR
BallReady can be used Indoors and Outdoors. Ball shooting distance can be set for safe indoor play. Outdoors the ball will launch further for more active exercise.

FOOD FREQUENCY RELEASE
BallReady can be set to release food for every 1 or 5 balls returned. Increase activity by requiring more ball returned for each treat reward. 

SET REGULAR MEAL SCHEDULE
Regular feedings can be set for every 12 or 24 hours. Make sure that your dog is eating his or her meals on a set schedule even when you are away.

story:
The SelfieBrick and its Augmented Reality App allows you to make any surface an instant, touch-sensitive scanner and send JPEG or PDF files to cloud services like Dropbox, perfectly organized and fast.

Stretch Goal - Compact Edition


The Story

A year ago I demonstrated a document management system, developed and deployed several years earlier, to a friend of mine who owns a small business.

Her initial skeptical and reluctant attitude to take a look at it quickly changed to a full blown excitement. She could hardly wait to start using it.

In her business, she often needs to quickly find old invoices (Excel, PDF files) and pictures of items associated with those invoices.

She also needs to archive and classify documents and photographs of physical items, sketches, whiteboard drawings using a smartphone when traveling abroad and where internet is often slow or unreliable. 

When the integrated App was developed, I found that taking a good picture while trying to hold the phone steady and horizontally was a challenge. Clicking the shutter would sometimes produce out of focus pictures.

Designing a portable copy stand for a smartphone was an obvious next step. 

Looking through several designs using 3D modeling techniques, I realized that it would be prohibitively expensive to manufacture them without a big upfront order. That's when the idea of utilizing a selfie stick placed in a "brick" was born. After all, many people already have a selfie stick - a simple accessory, the brick, turns the stick into a dual purpose item.  Not being as rigid as a copy stand, the stick could not prevent shaking caused by clicking, the Augmented Reality buttons solved the problem.

SelfieBrick Benefits

  • Scan large objects, (i.e. newspapers, books, paintings), that don't fit into regular flatbed scanners
  • No need to put a book upside down and/or press the lid to hold the book and potentially break the book's spine as can happen when using a flatbed scanner
  • You can sit at your desk instead of standing and holding the phone to maintain distance between the phone and the desk
  • Not touching the phone prevents out of focus images due to hand shaking
  • No need to constantly reorient the phone to prevent distorted or cropped images 
  • Leaves your hands free to do other things (i.e. flip pages in a natural way)
  • Works as fast as you flip pages


But why limit yourself to scanning?

You can point the Augmented Reality buttons at anything and have the App capture and send pictures automatically anywhere.

Examples of other use:

  • An overhead projector when used with Smart Personal Cloud locally or remotely
  • Door peephole camera motion sensor to automatically send/email pictures of any movement in front of it
  • Remotely controlled camera to take group/self pictures
  • While working (in a garage, backyard, kitchen) and having hands dirty/busy, take and send pictures without touching the phone to anywhere (for help, instructions, sharing)
  • Whiteboard drawings

How



When using a smartphone to take pictures of documents, people often face two challenges/problems:

  • Keeping the phone parallel to the document's surface and thus preventing distorted or skewed images
  • Holding the phone steady when pressing the shutter button, as tapping the phone may result in out of focus images

The SelfieBrick solves the first problem, while the App, with its Augmented Reality buttons solves the second.  In addition, the App provides numerous benefits that further simplify scanning, such as automatically converting images into single or multi-page PDF files, emailing or uploading them into the proper folder of one of the public cloud services (i.e. Dropbox), or multi-category classification when used with the Smart Personal Cloud system for which the App was originally designed.

When used with the Smart Personal Cloud, the App can automate a number of time consuming tasks. For example, when doing a comparative market research of a product, people often make bookmarks of similar products to create a list of candidates (Web pages) for a final review later. Instead of multi-step process and time consuming bookmark search, the App uses a single swipe to copy the Web page, assign categories and store it in the database. All this without leaving the page!  

Just like scanning books naturally, browsing the Web and saving pages in dedicated groups, is easy and natural. 


Selfie stick compatibility

Any Selfie stick (i.e. ReTrak) with the diameter of the handle at the bottom 3/4" (19 mm) is compatible.


SelfieBrick Standard Edition



SelfieBrick Executive Edition



Smart Personal Cloud

The App

Using patent-pending technology, the App can monitor "hot" areas defined by the position of the Augmented Reality Buttons relative to the pointed at image. Whether it is a desk below or a group of people doing a selfie snapshot at a distance, the change within the "hot" area will trigger the corresponding action (a snapshot or a file upload, email, classification).

FAQ

1)  Great idea! Is there an iPhone version coming soon?

Yes, the iPhone version is being investigated/prototyped and may be added as a Stretch Goal, if the campaign goal is reached.

2)  Is the idea of a SelfieBrick and Augmented Reality buttons patent protected?

Yes, several patents are pending.


Risks & Challenges

The technology works (tested on the Samsung Galaxy S4 and S5 smartphones), but it needs more tests and optimization using a larger variety of Android phones, networks, usage patterns and cloud services.

The funds will be used to manufacture the SelfieBricks and hire Software Engineers.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a donation, you can contribute. You can tell all of your family, friends, and colleagues about the SelfieBrick project by sharing the campaign on social media. 

Thank you!

About Go2Get Inc.
ALEX IVANOV, CEO
Experienced software engineer and entrepreneur, passionate about creating disruptive technologies, Alex got his experience building products working at Microsoft, a number of Startups and his own software development business Go2Get Inc.
Alex holds a M.S. in Electrical Engineering from North-West Technical University.

story:
ACUI was born a few months ago from our disappointment for the absence of a good application for everyone who use their tablets or their Android smartphone as a media center on their cars. Armed with enthusiasm and patience, we then started developing an application which would satisfy our needs in regards of aesthetics and functionality while trying to reduce interaction with standard Android GUI and use of external applications to a minimum. Following various forums we then noticed that there isn’t a real Android – based device with a good hardware and designed specifically to be installed on a automobile.

That’s how our project was born; this project includes not just the creation of a software meant to be used in-car, but also the production of a specific hardware aimed to improve and simplify the user experience as much as possible.



 In order to describe what ACUI is we need to describe the four types of set we will release. The app sets will all have a different GUI and two or more themes and they all designed to match everyone’s tastes.

  • ACUI Tab Set: This is our original project, a set of four different UIs designed to be used on devices with screens of 6” or more.
  • ACUI Phone Set :A set of four apps designed to be used inside the car on screens of 5” or less.
  • ACUI Moto Set: A set of four apps designed to be used by motorcycle riders. This is a different case, in fact there are many ways to place a smartphone on a motorcycle’s handlebar, which is why our apps will be developed while focusing on three main factors: device placement on the handlebar, device orientation, and the hand used.

Below you will find some example images to illustrate some possible combinations. The GUI shown in the images is just a placeholder, the final interface will be different.





We have developed two solutions in case you want to place your device at the center of the handlebar.

First solution requires the use of just one hand and a horizontally placed device, this app will be released both for right-handed or left-handed use ( pictures refer to the left-handed version).

On the other hand, the second solution allows you to use your device with both hands, in this case the device can be placed either horizontally or vertically.




The two images above refer to the case when you want to place your device on one of the two handlebar’s sides, either horizontally or vertically.

But our project doesn’t end with the development of ACUI Sets. In fact we will release some Android devices designed specifically to be placed on your car in the easiest way possible. I’m talking about ACUI Flap Screens that could be installed with a simple plug-and-play technique, the only thing you’ll need will be a AUX Input on your car stereo.


Besides Flap Screen devices will also release some devices with 2Din cases, these too will be universal.


In addition to our ACUI devices will release specific Bluetooth controllers which will allow you, by connecting to your android device, to control the applications without using the touchscreen, something similar to BMW’s iDrive controller or the one That can be found on Audi and Mercedes. The ACUI Controller will work with any Android device, you will then be able to use it even if you choose not to use one of our devices.


On the other hand, for ACIU Moto, In case we will reach an appropriate amount of funds, we will develop a special Bluetooth glove which will allow bikers to use the app without taking their hands off the handlebar.


Unlike the car controller version, which is just five buttons. The application will allow the user to set each button’s functionality depending on their needs.


Which cars will we support?

ALL OF THEM, provided that your car stereo supports AUX Input (3,5mm Jack). In fact we will release a case Flap which will be as universal as possible and compatible with every dashboards. However you will have the possibility to send. us an e-mail with the exact car model you’d like to be officially supported and, if the number of requests will be high enough to justify production, will will release specific Flap monitors for that car.


When will everything be released?

By June all our prototypes will be ready ( including the true controllers) along with a first version of all custom launcher for 2Din systems.

By July all the applications will be released both on our site and on Google Play Store, and in both cases you have free updates for life.

In September we will release The final version of our Bluetooth controllers.

As for the 2Din systems and ACUI Flap Monitors you will have to wait until November – December.


We have already contacted the suppliers who will build our systems and they are ready to confirm the order as soon as the campaign will come to an end.

However that might be some sort of delay, Since in this market and with totally new products delays a concrete possibility but we will try our best to meet our deadlines.

As for the apps, They will surely be released within this summer.
