story:
FEATURES

Military grade durability - Engineered using a military grade Polyurethane and our Nanotips® solution. TAPS' surface will resist abrasion in any lifestyle.

Waterproof - Designed to fit wet lifestyles, we used a water repellent (hydrophobic) blend to make sure TAPS will work in the wettest climates.

Flexible - The thin film, TAPS, combined with our adhesive backing gives TAPS the flexibility needed to withstand extreme wear conditions your gloves will endure. This is essential is keeping TAPS from peeling off your glove.

Nanoparticle infused material - The Nanoparticles is what makes TAPS work. These particles give this small little sticker has enough conductive power to activate any capacitive touchscreen device even through a glass screen protector.

Fingerprint Technology - We've made every TAPS with a unique fingerprint - This gives your gloves access to any biometric fingerprint scanner. We've also ensured that every TAPS comes with a different fingerprint - for security reasons, obviously.

FOR ANY LIFESTYLE 

TAPS is engineered with simplicity and ease-of-use in mind. Whatever your lifestyle is, whatever your hobby may be, TAPS is great for adding touch screen function to your existing gloves. Military, snowboarders, motorcyclists, mountain bikers - just stick some TAPS to get connected.

RUNNERS. Stay connected to any device on the go.

 MOTORSPORTS. TAPS is built with durability in mind.

 WINTER SPORTS. Durable and waterproof. Use them for snow sports

 OUTDOOR STUFF. Stuff to do with outdoors.

PHOTOGRAPHY. Fly your drone in the cold weather. Don't let gloves limit your control.

 

WHY TAPS? 

TAPS will give you the ability to transform any glove into a touchscreen glove. Whether it's gloves you already own, broken touchscreen gloves, or just new gloves you want to make compatible - TAPS will make those gloves functional.

Unlimited choices - Touchscreen gloves limit your selection of styles. With TAPS, you can make any glove touchscreen compatible - Don't limit yourself to certain styles and comfort with touchscreen gloves.

Durability - If you've ever owned touchscreen gloves, you might have been pretty disappointed with how long they last before they stop working. TAPS is built with a unique polyurethane material which makes this material extremely durable in any situation.

Existing Gloves - If you already have gloves, TAPS let's you upgrade those pairs.

Repair tool - If you already have touchscreen gloves and they've stopped working. Grab a pack of TAPS and make them functional again.

Lifestyles - Some industries or lifestyles still don't make touchscreen gloves. We'll, now there's TAPS for that.

TOUCH ID COMPATIBLE

Every TAPS has a unique ability to work with biometric fingerprint scanners. Each TAPS has it's very own unique print so you can be sure your device is locked to your own print. 

Security - We've made each print on TAPS uniquely different. This means there are no TAPS with the same fingerprint - not even the ones in the same pack. (see below for the technology on how we did this)

Adding TAPS - Simply register your TAPS as a fingerprint on your phone like you would any other finger.

Multiple Touch ID's per phone - Each device can typically store up to 6 different fingerprints. Save TAPS as one of them.

TECHNOLOGY 

Conductive nano-material - TAPS is a blend of our proprietary Nanotips® liquid solution and a military grade polyurethane. Each TAPS has enough conductivity built in to activate any capacitive device. 

Adhesion - We've partnered with 3M to ensure TAPS has enough adhesion to any surface. Using one of their strongest adhesives, we were able to line each of our nano-material layers (TAPS) with 3M's technology. This allows the material to remain on the glove at all times.

Shape - Creating a shape that was small enough, yet conductive enough to work with any glove and screen was a challenge. We've gone through hundreds of interations and samples to create our final shape. This shape we've chosen will work with any glove and is the best shape to reduce strain on the flexibiliy and peel effects associated with the glove.

Touch ID - Security before convenience. We've made sure that every TAPS comes with a unique artificial fingerprint to ensure that no TAPS are ever the same. To do this, we use a rotational stamp that moves along the X and Y axis when stamping the TAPS print - Giving TAPS thousands of misaligned micro rivets in the material.

MEET THE TEAM

story:
Sure, there are other batteries out there, but none offer the combined features of:

✅Power Delivery Technology, charging your devices faster than ever in just 1 hour
✅A total of 4 charging ports. Two 100W USB-C PD3.0 ports & two 18W USB-A QC3.0 ports 
✅Pass Through Technology to charge all your devices and AlsterPlus simultaneously
✅Power Sharing Technology for simultaneous charging 
✅A total output power of 156W 
✅A USB-C HUB function 
✅100W USB-C cable included!

AlsterPlus does it all and more, all at an affordable price - making our competition obsolete!


Referral Contest!

$ 300 
Refer as many as you can, when the total contributions at least reach $300, you will get 1x Free USB-C to USB-C Cable PD 100W 1M.

$ 500 
Refer as many as you can, when the total contributions at least reach $500, you will get 1x Free AlsterPlus 112W Power Adapter.

$ 1,000 
Refer as many as you can, when the total contributions at least reach $1,000, you will get 1x Free AlsterPlus.

$ 3,000
Refer as many as you can, when the total contributions at least reach $3,000, you will get 3x FREE AlsterPlus + 1 Free AlsterPlus 112W Power Adapter.
( * Please check here for Indiegogo referral contest program regulation.)

Forget the hassle of juggling multiple accessories. Charge all of your devices simultaneously with two USB-C and two USB-A ports.Charge multiple devices and sync data simultaneously. With the USB 2.0, transfer data quickly and safely up to 480Mbp/s.FOUR High Power Charging interfaces, with a full recharge time of one hour!

USB-C port 1: Max 100W USB-C Power Delivery 3.0 Input & Output
USB-C port 2: Max 100W USB-C Power Delivery 3.0 Input & Output
USB-A port 1: Max 18W USB-A Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 Output 
USB-A port 2: Max 18W USB-A Qualcomm Quick Charge 3.0 Output


100W USB-C Power Delivery Profile (Input&Output): 5V/3A, 9V/3A, 12V/3A, 15V/3A, 20V/3A, 20V/5A  
18W USB-A Output QC Profile: 3.6V-12V, Max 18W


AlsterPlus is a powerful 27000mAh/100Wh battery, but with USB-C Power Delivery 3.0 100W technology, it can be recharged in around one hour.Versatile Charging
Charge multiple devices and sync data simultaneously. 
With Power Sharing Technology, AlsterPlus will automatically sensor and share the power when multiple devices are connected. 
Pass through charging allows you to recharge the AlsterPlus from any port while charging your devices at the same time.AlsterPlus is also able to charge and SYNC your new iPad Pro.
Sleek, Compact and LightweightAlsterPlus is high capacity, yet sleek, and compact at only 21oz. It is also completely airline compliant making it a powerful companion for travel. Keep your most used devices charged while camping, during road trips or anywhere else you need a charge.
The Most Powerful Battery Pack AvailableAlsterPlus is powerful enough to charge MacBooks, iPads, phones, GoPros, Cameras, Headphones, Speakers, handheld gaming systems - even 100W Wacom tablets!

 Safe and ReliableMade with the best quality materials, complete with overcharge, discharge, current, temperature & short circuit protection for optimal safety.

Innovative design meets high-technology in an affordable way! Our young and energetic team specializes in developing cutting-edge accessories for all smart devices, such as portable battery, computer peripherals, audio gear and more.
Our mission is to deliver the cutting-edge products with superior quality that exceed customers’ exceptions. We strive to design innovative products and always aim to improve people’s lives.
Stay with AlsterPlus, stay Powered-Up, get connected with your loved ones."Innovative design meets high-technology in an affordable way"!Full functional prototype demo video as below.

story:
What do You Have to Say About The World?

MoockApp offers an online tool to perform an unified management of all your social networks while running also your own mobile applications (updated at the same time as your social networks). This permits to have a better relationship with your customers, users and new potential clients, offering a very good fidelization tool.

This project is based on the idea of a service ready to manage at the same time social networks, blogs, cms and marketing campaigns and also to create, configure and manage mobile applications!

App to date for everyone!!

MoockApp gives you the chance. Have your own professional mobile app! Easy to use, easy to manage, and easy to configure! You don’t need any kind of technical knowledge, just a little bit of taste when coming to pick up the best scheme of colors and images.

MoockApp is the first service to build mobile applications created for everyone. What does it mean? The services that currently exist are created for people who already know how to write code and they’re not easy to use. MoockApp set out to change it. This means you don’t need to know a bit of code to build your very own app. Cool, right?! We think so.


The most simple dashboards of all, WYSIWYG

MoockApp makes it simple. Just pick the template, colors and images you want to create stunning mobile applications. All apps installed by your users will automatically update when you change your configuration!


Customise it Completely and Frecuently

MoockApp styles, all yours. You will be able to create and post your own styles at the same time that our team designs new and stunning themes for your apps.


Ready for Sharing:

MoockApp does something ridiculously simple when it comes to your sharing capabilities. It lets you synchronize all your social networks, such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn with just TWO clicks and then you may be able to manage, post, delete and share everywhere with just one click. No endless plugins required to do stuff that everyone wants to do. Connect your posts to anywhere, rank properly in search engines, and much more.


Writing content from one place to everywhere!

With MoockApp, you will be able to do the same as with other important social management softwares but adding the power of mobile applications to your posts. The easier way to manage everything. Furthermore you will be also able to post your news in the most common CMS like Wordpress for instance.


Every penny we make from our customers will be re-invested to make MoockApp better and grow the platform

The sad thing about software projects funded on Kickstarter is that they usually have an initial flurry of activity when they launch, and then they slowly but surely die off when the money runs out because they have no business model to keep going. We want to build MoockApp to be a self-sustaining  project. 

Users supporting us = revenue = development = better software = more users = more revenue = more development = well... you get the idea.


Where We Are Now

We've been slowly working on MoockApp since we got the idea on Spring 2013. As you can see from the videos, we have a real working prototype of the Service and the Android application - but there's still a lot to do.

With your support we can work hard to finish the first complete release of MoockApp  and get it out into the world. Your backing will help fund:

  • Development time. We want to work on MoockApp and nothing but MoockApp in 2014. We want to ship the first public version of MoockApp by the end of the summer. Perhaps sooner depending on the resources provided by this campaign.
  • Legal stuff. We need to do a couple of important things like register trademarks, and register properly as a non-profit organisation.
  • Infrastructure. We've got tons of work to do to complete the MoockApp community website and platform to allow us to properly support users, provide hosting, and be the home of MoockApp.


Stretch goals!

  • Initial goal $5,000 : This will help us get copyrights, trademark and patent applications started; plus the grunt paperwork and legal work of getting up and running. 
  • Stretch goal #1 $7,500 : If we can make this, we can IMMEDIATELY develop the iPhone app version of MoockApp! And al least two more theme templates!
  • Stretch goal #2 $10,000 : Lets do it!, we will develop the Windows mobile app version of MoockApp! And al least two more theme templates!
  • Stretch goal #3 $12,500 : If we can make this, we can IMMEDIATELY develop the Android Administration APP to manage everything from your mobile! And al least two more theme templates!
  • Stretch goal #4 $15,000 : Yeha!, we will develop the iPhone Administration APP to manage everything from your mobile! And al least two more theme templates!
  • Stretch goal #5 $18,000 : If we achieve to unlock this, we will synchronize MoockApp with most social networks! And also we will develop a statistics module about post impact over customers and users and all other kind of interesting data for your reports! And al least two more theme templates!
  • Stretch goal #6 $XXX : Leeets ride!, we will post more and more stretch goals unlocking the previous ones! surprise surprisee!


MoockApp will be always growing and being supported

Our aim is to work full time with MoockApp adding incredible functionalities and capabilities over time. The first release will work over Android  with the initial stretch goal but with time we will add all other mobile platforms to the offer (iOS, Windows phone and perhaps Blackberry) This is not just what you can read here but other very interesting features such as:

  • Community manager services.
  • New automatic system to improve the rank in search engines.
  • New themes for mobile apps.
  • New social networks linked with MoockApp (youtube, tuenti, dribbble, googleplus…)
  • Marketing statistics about post impact over customers and users
  • New mobile app modules (online shop module, events module, portfolio module…)
  • All your suggestions are always welcome to make MoockApp better
  • Synchronization with important CMS (Wordpress, Joomle, Custom, Ghost, Blogs…)
  • Email marketing campaigns
  • Administration APP to manage everything from your mobile


The People Behind MoockApp

My name is Saul Remis. I've been building websites, mobile applications and software since 2003. I am currently responsible for software development of high valuable and innovative solutions for the metal sector industry. Is part of my job develop technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity. I've designed, built, and worked on application for companies including ArcelorMittal, Gijón´s Council, Tecnologym, University of Oviedo and many others.

My main partner in crime, Silvia Bernardo, is a Senior Pre-sale at Prosodie where she is currently working with a small team. Silvia has been working with international customers for over 5 years, listening their needs and providing IT solutions to their problems so do not hesitate to write us for any question or suggestion! All this needs and questions together conform the birth of MoockApp.

Equally, this first prototype of MoockApp would not have been possible without the generous contributions of many other people:

  • Code –Simon Remis
  • Marketing - Encarna Quesada
  • Administration – Covadonga Lorente
  • Service desk - Rebeca López
story_txt:
What do You Have to Say About The World?MoockApp offers an online tool to perform an unified management of all your social networks while running also your own mobile applications (updated at the same time as your social networks). This permits to have a better relationship with your customers, users and new potential clients, offering a very good fidelization tool.This project is based on the idea of a service ready to manage at the same time social networks, blogs, cms and marketing campaigns and also to create, configure and manage mobile applications!App to date for everyone!!MoockApp gives you the chance. Have your own professional mobile app! Easy to use, easy to manage, and easy to configure! You don’t need any kind of technical knowledge, just a little bit of taste when coming to pick up the best scheme of colors and images.MoockApp is the first service to build mobile applications created for everyone. What does it mean? The services that currently exist are created for people who already know how to write code and they’re not easy to use. MoockApp set out to change it. This means you don’t need to know a bit of code to build your very own app. Cool, right?! We think so.The most simple dashboards of all, WYSIWYGMoockApp makes it simple. Just pick the template, colors and images you want to create stunning mobile applications. All apps installed by your users will automatically update when you change your configuration!Customise it Completely and FrecuentlyMoockApp styles, all yours. You will be able to create and post your own styles at the same time that our team designs new and stunning themes for your apps.Ready for Sharing:MoockApp does something ridiculously simple when it comes to your sharing capabilities. It lets you synchronize all your social networks, such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn with just TWO clicks and then you may be able to manage, post, delete and share everywhere with just one click. No endless plugins required to do stuff that everyone wants to do. Connect your posts to anywhere, rank properly in search engines, and much more.

Writing content from one place to everywhere!With MoockApp, you will be able to do the same as with other important social management softwares but adding the power of mobile applications to your posts. The easier way to manage everything. Furthermore you will be also able to post your news in the most common CMS like Wordpress for instance.

Every penny we make from our customers will be re-invested to make MoockApp better and grow the platformThe sad thing about software projects funded on Kickstarter is that they usually have an initial flurry of activity when they launch, and then they slowly but surely die off when the money runs out because they have no business model to keep going. We want to build MoockApp to be a self-sustaining  project. Users supporting us = revenue = development = better software = more users = more revenue = more development = well... you get the idea.Where We Are NowWe've been slowly working on MoockApp since we got the idea on Spring 2013. As you can see from the videos, we have a real working prototype of the Service and the Android application - but there's still a lot to do.With your support we can work hard to finish the first complete release of MoockApp  and get it out into the world. Your backing will help fund:Development time. We want to work on MoockApp and nothing but MoockApp in 2014. We want to ship the first public version of MoockApp by the end of the summer. Perhaps sooner depending on the resources provided by this campaign.Legal stuff. We need to do a couple of important things like register trademarks, and register properly as a non-profit organisation.Infrastructure. We've got tons of work to do to complete the MoockApp community website and platform to allow us to properly support users, provide hosting, and be the home of MoockApp.Stretch goals!

Initial goal $5,000 : This will help us get copyrights, trademark and patent applications started; plus the grunt paperwork and legal work of getting up and running. 

Stretch goal #1 $7,500 : If we can make this, we can IMMEDIATELY develop the iPhone app version of MoockApp! And al least two more theme templates!

Stretch goal #2 $10,000 : Lets do it!, we will develop the Windows mobile app version of MoockApp! And al least two more theme templates!


Stretch goal #3 $12,500 : If we can make this, we can IMMEDIATELY develop the Android Administration APP to manage everything from your mobile! And al least two more theme templates!


Stretch goal #4 $15,000 : Yeha!, we will develop the iPhone Administration APP to manage everything from your mobile! And al least two more theme templates!


Stretch goal #5 $18,000 : If we achieve to unlock this, we will synchronize MoockApp with most social networks! And also we will develop a statistics module about post impact over customers and users and all other kind of interesting data for your reports! And al least two more theme templates!


Stretch goal #6 $XXX : Leeets ride!, we will post more and more stretch goals unlocking the previous ones! surprise surprisee!

MoockApp will be always growing and being supportedOur aim is to work full time with MoockApp adding incredible functionalities and capabilities over time. The first release will work over Android  with the initial stretch goal but with time we will add all other mobile platforms to the offer (iOS, Windows phone and perhaps Blackberry) This is not just what you can read here but other very interesting features such as:
Community manager services.
New automatic system to improve the rank in search engines.
New themes for mobile apps.
New social networks linked with MoockApp (youtube, tuenti, dribbble, googleplus…)
Marketing statistics about post impact over customers and users
New mobile app modules (online shop module, events module, portfolio module…)
All your suggestions are always welcome to make MoockApp better
Synchronization with important CMS (Wordpress, Joomle, Custom, Ghost, Blogs…)
Email marketing campaigns
Administration APP to manage everything from your mobile

I am currently responsible for software development of high valuable and innovative solutions for the metal sector industry. Is part of my job develop technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity. I've designed, built, and worked on application for companies including ArcelorMittal, Gijón´s Council, Tecnologym, University of Oviedo and many others.My main partner in crime, Silvia Bernardo, is a Senior Pre-sale at Prosodie where she is currently working with a small team. Silvia has been working with international customers for over 5 years, listening their needs and providing IT solutions to their problems so do not hesitate to write us for any question or suggestion! story:
TLDR WhitePad is a portable whiteboard shaped like a smartphone, for you to design your next UI on.

What is WhitePad?

We all love whiteboards! 

Unfortunately most whiteboards are HUGE, while our UI prototypes are supposed to fit on a tiny mobile screen. It's super easy to forget about that and sketch an amazing design, that actually will only makes sense on that GIANT whiteboard. 

This is why we developed WhitePad - it's a tiny whiteboard in a shape of an iPhone. Using WhitePad feels just like using a regular whiteboard, except now you actually have to make an effort and fit the design in the bounds of the smartphone's screen. When you're done with your sketch you can actually feel the UI yourself or hand it over to someone for quick assesment.

WhitePad will ship in two sizes: 

* 115mm x 58mm
* 123mm x 58mm

Every piece has printed the outline of the screen, so you can sketch precisely.

 

Where will the money go

We believe in crowdfunding. We believe in WhitePad too. 
We hope you'll support our initiative, so we can bring WhitePad to the market very soon! We never wanted our funding goal to be sky high, instead we set the minimum so we can start the production right away.

All of the money we raise will finance the manufacturing process.

WhitePad is past the development phase and it's already being used in couple of companies, all we need is your help and support!

 

About AppDesignAid

AppDesignAid's focus is to design and develop great tools for UI designers. We've been involved in a number of projects and based on our experience, we think there's a number of ways designer's life can be improved. We'll implement them one by one, and WhitePad happens to be the very first one!

story:
Short Summary

I just recently found out about my Aunt Jere needing surgery to correct a serious issue she has been dealing with in her spine. She was involved in a car accident a number of years ago that damaged her spinal cord and it has recently turned into her having spasms and serious complications with her nervous system. I am hoping to raise money for her surgery so that she may regain a quality of life better than what is projected if she doesn't have the surgery. Please help to raise money for my Aunt's surgery and God bless you all!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, please share the link so that others may contribute and help an awesome lady through a trying time in her life.

Thank you and God bless you!

story:
Meet us enRUe!

 

Using the enRUe app, citizen journalists can make and load audio collaboratively, see each other's edits, and comment back and forth in real time - like Google Docs, but with audio.

 

enRUe will reduce the technology – and the time – needed to make news content - and the best news is, we already have a proto-type!

 

The Problem

  • Imagine posting a call for personal stories from a flood, a city services strike or from a major arts events. Dozens- even hundreds- of citizen journalists can answer the assignment, report and collect sound, using their phones to record audio.
  • In the old days, all these reporters would have to go back their community radio station or studio to load the audio into an editor. To work on audio with co-producers, the only options were face to face meetings or a fileshare service, uploading version by pain-staking version.

 

Not anymore! Record it, see what others are adding on the same news assignment and where they are on the map. Comment on their edits in real-time, from anywhere. Get instant feedback and load your story for air faster than ever before.

 

 

The Solution

 

enRUe will be the first to make it possible to record and edit audio collaboratively. It saves time and maximizes the power of crowd sourcing talent. Editors can give instant feedback and journalists can review edits as they happen. Editing is a true conversation.

 

enRUe will be geo-tagged and uploaded by mobile app contributors. Everyone can see the editing, map the contributors and immediately give and receive feedback. 

 

Help us make news for the community, by the community.

  

 

Who will use it?

Community radio stations, podcasters, students and journalists.

With enRUe, crowd-sourced community radio and podcast production is quick and easy.

 

enRUe's vision is grassroots: using the unmatchable volunteer power of citizen journalists!

 

We cannot do it without you: Citizen journalists, please donate and meet us enRUe!


Who are we?

Campaign for 2013:

Naomi Aro from SourceFabric: Building the nuts and bolts

Bart Murphy from Keel Media: Doing up design

Emily Joveski (Kootenay Co-op Radio- thanks you!) and Jacky Tuinstra Harrison from The Scope at Ryerson: Testing, launch and incubation via a new Ryerson student media project

*****With many thanks to the National Campus and Community Radio Association and the GroundWire project: big thanks to C.J Albinati, Gretchen King, Shelley Robinson, Freida Werden, Omme Rahemtullah, David and Giana at CKDU and Anabel Khoo among the many other supporters who have helped along the way!

story:
The Backstory

OVAL was created by a parent as a way to help prevent prescription drug and alcohol abuse. A few years ago, Rich Cosgrove's teenage son expressed concern over the rampant use of these substances among his peers. Given the growing epidemic of the abuse of these substances and how they can potentially lead to other drug use and addiction, Rich began to think of an unobtrusive way for parents to monitor their medicine and liquor cabinets. And the idea for OVAL was born.


But It Began To Evolve...

The idea for OVAL began to develop further.  Why just monitor motion when we can have it do so much more?  

We began to work on a prototype and within 10 months had OVAL sensors detecting changes in motion, light, moisture, temperature and  proximity.  This enabled OVAL to have thousands of additional uses.  Not only can parents use these sensors to protect sensitive and potentially dangerous items around their home, but everyone could now use OVAL to protect the people, pets and things they care about most.


The Technology


OVAL sensor demo of our motion detection feature:
OVAL sensor demo of our luminosity detection feature:
OVAL sensor demo of our temperature detection feature:

Meet our Team


Risks and Challenges

As with any innovative tech project, challenges will emerge during the production process.  Collectively, our core team has decades of hands-on, custom manufacturing experience.  This experience runs the gamut from packaging, injection molding, tooling to avionics, software engineering, biomedical, and consumer electronics.  We have conducted extensive research, built numerous iterations of fully functioning OVAL prototypes, tested, and received ongoing feedback from consumers and technical experts.  

We maintain long standing business relationships with manufacturers who partner with leading consumer electronics companies.  The selected manufacturers have reviewed our project, prototypes and plan.  They look forward to partnering with OVAL to produce a high quality, professional standard product.   

A Final Thank You!

We invite you being part of this amazing venture and join our OVAL family.

Check out our website for more updates and information about OVAL

www.meetoval.com

Please support our social media!

Facebook

Twitter 

And, if you like what you see here, please help us spread the word!

Thanks again!

story:
Short Summary

The idea came to life based on our experiences on campus and in the city. Late in the evening, when streets are dark, our safety concerns rise significantly. But one can’t call police just because he is feeling unsafe. 

Our application Friendly Help provides secure and private way to be safe on the streets. When feeling unsafe, user selects one of the modes of tracking, either friend option or campus police (at participating colleges). Then selected friends get a real-time track of the user with associated status. In case of police tracking option, campus police receives anonymous tracking information and status. If something happens on the way, user can send instant alarm, with his location pinpointed on the map. The application also allows to send location to selected friends and chat with individual users or friends circles.

The key features of our application include:

  • Adult style safety application
  • Real-time tracking with an alert button: activated and controlled by user. No information is shared with user's friends until user decides to do so.
  • Location sharing with friends
  • Chat room

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we are testing application. To finish application we need money to pay for communication services, beta-testing, developing application for other platforms and web-interface. 

Our perks include beta-testing, contributor certificate, being featured as a contributor and a t-shirt. 

If we do not reach our entire goal (which hopefully would not happen) the funds raised will go to paying the most urgent expenses: communication services and beta-testing. Developing applications for other platforms is one of the most costly parts of our project.

The Impact

Our application will help to make the world safer. It would contribute to lowering number of crimes on campus and help freshman and their parents adapt to the changed situation.

Risks & Challenges

We are determined to finish our project and bring the product to life. However, no business project can omit analyzing and admitting existing risks and challenges. At the moment there are three types of risks:

  • Technical risks:  Application has a complicated implementation and is dependent on Apple, Microsoft and text-message operators for successful functioning. Despite a high reliability of the operators listed, there is always a chance one of them would malfunction.

  • Financial risks:  There is a risk that project will not get enough funding to finance the starting costs of the application. (You can help us with this one!)

  • Conceptual risks: This can not be considered a universal safety system. If smartphone battery dies, the application would not work. Smartphone with access to the Internet is required for successful application functioning.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends about our project and share! We would greatly appreciate any help!

story:
Q&A

Please do remember,password must be set beforewe insert the network cable.

Q:Can the Box be used when we are abroad?

A:

As you see,we have configured British&European&American&Australian standard plugs,you can use in the above areas.

Q:How can the Box recognize your device and if the battery is low or not?

A:

There is a built-in smart chip which can recognize your device and the battery.

Q:How to set WIFI password?

A:

Please do remember,password must be set beforewe insert the network cable.Connect the Wifi named "DIDXXXX" with mobile phone, open webpage, input 192.168.16.1, the password&account are both 'admin'.

Enter the setting page→select the wireless setting page→select the security setting page to change the password&account.

Q:How to change the network and  into wifi?

A:

There is one network socket in one side of Design.D Charger & Wifi Box, insert the network cable into the socket,after few seconds,the

Wifi indicator light blue light will be on,that means,we can start to use the Wifi.

Q:Can the Box be reset?

A:

Sure.There's one button for one-key reset in the periphery of the Box.


What We Need

It's our first time to share our design with customers around the world .We hope to hear your voice about how to improve our design,of course,we want you to share your feeling about using our Box.

It will be good to hear the experience of using the Box from you,what's more,it will help us to develop the next product which is about to be released in the next month.

We look forward to sharing our next product with you.

story:
What is Park On The Fly?

Created by concerned UF students, Park on the Fly is a massively scalable parking management system designed to make buying, selling, and finding parking simple.  The system allows consumers to purchase parking before leaving home, removing the hassle of searching for an open lot.  Our clients are property owners looking to monetize unused or not fully utilized parking or land near high traffic areas.  Our clients are also individuals that want to sell their home parking spaces for special events and day to day parking.  We are currently active at 13 locations, even 1 parking garage, and are working hard to add locations daily, even in new cities!

How Does It Work?

Simply go to our website and tell us where you're going and when you're going there.  We'll show you the lots we manage and let you buy your spot hours, days, or even weeks in advance.  The day of your reservation just drive to the lot and park.  No printouts necessary!  We're also currently developing our mobile app which will allow you to find and buy parking in under 30 seconds.  We expect to release the app within the next two months. 

In fact, try out our service with 2 hours of FREE parking at our website.  Just use this coupon code:

  • Donate-On-Indiegogo.com(For More Free Parking)
  • Copy paste the whole line above as the coupon code

Check it out, we think you'll like what we're doing and will want to support our efforts.  Please note that due to expected demand, we can't guarantee you a spot.  The code will be active for the duration of the campaign, so if all the spaces are full come back and try again!

Who's Running The Show?

We're Gator Grads! We're graduate students, a former consultant, and a nuclear engineer supported by an amazing programming team that counts billion dollar companies among its clients.  We believe that there is absolutely no reason why anyone should spend twenty or thirty minutes looking for parking.

Contests Attended And Media

We've been invited to compete in several business competitions.  You can see Sargent and Aashish presenting at the Wake Forest Elevator Pitch competition at the top of this page.  We qualified to present at Wake Forest after beating out applicants all over the country.
 
We were also one of 11 student run companies worldwide invited to present at the HKUST MBA International Business Plan in Hong Kong.  They flew us out there to represent The University of FL.  It was a great experience that has kept us moving on the right path.

Why Do We Need Your Support?

Over the past year and a half we've proven the business model.  We provide real value to people parking, property owners, and feedback from our existing customers has been amazing.  The next step is to expand.  We plan to use funds raised from this campaign expand our business beyond just Gainesville and to increase our user base.  We've found that our biggest problem is publicity.  When people find us, they keep using our service.  In fact, the average user has completed over 16 transactions!

Get More FREE Parking Hours by Spreading the Word!

Share this campaign on Facebook via the Like! button at the top of this page.  Maybe say in the share window "Friends, please donate to this worthy cause and get free parking by campus, downtown, and more!"  You can do that currently, no reason to wait.  Friends who see it can take action, earning you free hours, shown below in chart.  We'll keep track of it.  In the coming days, we will send all donors an individual coupon and referral code that their friends can use to purchase discounted parking. We are also implementing a rewards program that will allow anyone to earn free parking when their personal coupon codes are used. Last, but not least, if you know property owners that might want to sell parking please contact us directly. We have a generous cash commission program in place for individuals and organizations that bring us new clients.

For every person you refer to our Indiegogo page that donates, we'll give you five hours of FREE parking!  In order to get credit for your referrals please ask your friends to enter your email address and name when they register on our website.  If your friend already has an account with us, ask them to use the "Contact Us" page to send us your email address. Also, you don't have to donate to earn the referral hours.  Each of your referrals that donate will earn you 5 hours of parking that will be distributed on a monthly basis or at the end of the campaign.  Even if we don't have lots in your city yet, feel free to share the campaign and simply use your referral hours once spaces open in your city!  Thank you for your time, donations to system, and have a great day from our team!
story_txt:
What is Park On The Fly?
Created by concerned UF students, Park on the Fly is a massively scalable parking management system designed to make buying, selling, and finding parking simple.  The system allows consumers to purchase parking before leaving home, removing the hassle of searching for an open lot.  Our clients are property owners looking to monetize unused or not fully utilized parking or land near high traffic areas.  Our clients are also individuals that want to sell their home parking spaces for special events and day to day parking.  We are currently active at 13 locations, even 1 parking garage, and are working hard to add locations daily, even in new cities!


How Does It Work?
Simply go to our website and tell us where you're going and when you're going there.  We'll show you the lots we manage and let you buy your spot hours, days, or even weeks in advance.  The day of your reservation just drive to the lot and park.  No printouts necessary!  We're also currently developing our mobile app which will allow you to find and buy parking in under 30 seconds.  We expect to release the app within the next two months. 


In fact, try out our service with 2 hours of FREE parking at our website.  Just use this coupon code:

Donate-On-Indiegogo.com(For More Free Parking)
Copy paste the whole line above as the coupon code


Check it out, we think you'll like what we're doing and will want to support our efforts.  Please note that due to expected demand, we can't guarantee you a spot.  The code will be active for the duration of the campaign, so if all the spaces are full come back and try again!

For every person you refer to our Indiegogo page that donates, we'll give you five hours of FREE parking!  In order to get credit for your referrals please ask your friends to enter your email address and name when they register on our website.  If your friend already has an account with us, ask them to use the "Contact Us" page to send us your email address. Also, you don't have to donate to earn the referral hours.  Each of your referrals that donate will earn you 5 hours of parking that will be distributed on a monthly basis or at the end of the campaign.  Even if we don't have lots in your city yet, feel free to share the campaign and simply use your referral hours once spaces open in your city!  Thank you for your time, donations to system, and have a great day from our team!

story:
Welcome to our secret campaign, intrepid biohacker!

As you know, the MyoLink is the first open-source, wireless, wearable sensor that continuously measures your muscles, heart, and brain.

But... this isn’t our real funding campaign, just a call for dedicated and passionate beta testers.

This is how it's going to work:  In about 6 months (or perhaps sooner), you will get a pre-production model of the Myolink sensor in Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) flavor along with a six-month supply of patches. This MyoLink is yours to keep. You're getting a MyoLink before anyone else in the world, and this is essentially a preorder for you to get in early and pave the path of one of the first wireless, wearable open-source EMG / EKG / EEG body monitoring sensors. The main campaign will deliver MyoLinks in about 9 months. That means you will get yours at least three months before anyone else!

What is changing between the pictured prototype and the one you are getting?

1. We are modifying the current plastic enclosure to eliminate the electromechanical junction. The version you get will look more like a band-aid. Why? We want you to be able to use your MyoLink everywhere, all the time, without worrying about separation of the adhesive from the module.

2. We are switching from ANT to BLE as our wireless communication protocol. That’s so you don’t need a dongle to connect to your iPhone / Android smartphone.

There are several other changes we are considering, but those depend on meeting stretch goals in our main campaign, which we will launch in a couple weeks.

The main purpose of this campaign is to get our beta test group organized and funnel those most interested in this technology into our team of core beta testers / elite super-users.

And remember, whatever you do, don't tell anyone about this campaign! We don't want it to go viral; we want it to go anti-viral! There is an absolute cap of 100 pre-production MyoLinks for this beta group, and we would prefer the size to be about 50. We will launch our main campaign in a couple weeks. Stay tuned.

story:
Hello Indiegogo, my name is Andrew Bierbower and I come to you with a unique opportunity and project. Before I begin, I'll give you a backstory on how this entire idea came to mind.

I am an engineering student at Texas State University in San Marcos, Texas. I was in the middle of one of my physics classes when we briefly went over a topic called piezoelectricity. Now, I won't sit here and try to explain every little detail but generally, it means that when a kinetic force is applied to certain materials, an electric charge is created. The applications for this are endless. However, the one I am choosing to focus on is renewable energy.

My team and I have found a way to create a step pad that generates electricity with every step. This type of pad can be placed anywhere in the world: schools, airports, malls, etc. Anywhere that has a high volume of foot traffic is a perfect place for this product. Not only is it an easy way to produce renewable energy, it is also very passive, requiring very little effort on the user. All you have to do is step down and voila, you have created electricity.

Now, we come to you, Indiegogo and the Internet, to help us secure funding in order to produce out first prototype and to begin to market this product. The future is happening now. Don't you want to be a part of it?

story:
The Goal

We intend to build a cluster of Raspberry Pi devices, initially configured as a build farm and tasked with compiling all the source code of Ubuntu Saucy (current stable 13.10), Precise (Current LTS 12.04) and Trusty (Next release, 14.04). The objective is to produce a bootable SD card image and host binary repositories for all packages that will build.

The History

Back when the Raspberry Pi was in development it was shown running Ubuntu 9.04, Jaunty Jackalope. This was the last Ubuntu release that supported the ARMv6 instruction set, from that point on Ubuntu was optimised for newer ARM chips and would not run on the Broadcom chip that the Pi used. I am the point of contact of the Ubuntu UK Local Community team and I was dead excited about this little computer with it's exposed PCB and low price point. I asked some of the Ubuntu ARM folk if they could support it going forward, but that wasn't going to be possible, they didn't have the resources to build for two ARM platforms and the bottom line was that the Pi probably wasn't going to provide a good user experience for the increasingly heavy Ubuntu user interface. This was sad, but it was the situation. I was a bit concerned that the Raspberry Pi foundation was proceeding on the basis that Jaunty was available - it was already old, going out of support and was a dead end, there were going to be no future updates for it. I was concerned that the UK Local community was going to be landed with a lot of new users who were having a poor user experience and there would be nothing we could do about it. Reluctantly I approached the Raspberry Pi foundation (I met the lovely Liz and Eben at an event in Oxford) and shared my concerns with them, and suggested Debian was the way forward, so the Pi would have a system based on a platform Ubuntu users would be familiar with, that would get updates.

So this was sad, I wasn't happy about it, the foundation wasn't happy about it, many users were not happy about it, but it was much better to have a new Debian with updates and prospects than an old dead end Ubuntu release.

Moving on to the present, the Raspberry Pi is a huge success, Rasbian is a great operating platform for it, the LXDE desktop is fine, the Wayland demo was brilliant and loads of cool projects are happening based on the Pi. We still want Ubuntu on it though. We are using it in embedded projects, it is also turning up in things like the OpenERP Point of Sale kit, situations where it doesn't need a responsive user interface (or a user interface at all). It would be great to know that all the libraries we are using on it are the same versions we are using on other computers that are running Ubuntu. It might be nice to see what the Ubuntu Unity desktop looks like on the Pi, especially Unity 8 running in Mir, but that explicitly isn't a goal. This project aims to build everything that will build from source without too much hassle. If that gets us a desktop then great, if it gets us a command line with python, that is great too.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to build a compile farm, based on the Raspberry Pi platform. 

We will construct a rack (wood, home made, probably based on something from IKEA) that contains 32 PI build machines and one or two controlling nodes with lots of disk space. The controller will run wanna-build and will host the source repository and built binaries. The build machines will all grab packages from the wanna-build queue, set up a build environment and build them.

Each node needs a Pi (£25), a 32GB SD card (£20), Power supply (£6), Networking (£8), power cabling and shelving (£11) so about £70 per node. 32 nodes sounds like a nice number, which is £2240, the controller nodes and assorted other costs and contingency bring us up to the £2500 target.

Should we raise more than the £2500 we are asking for then we will probably add more nodes to the cluster and spend more time fixing stuff that doesn't build from source. Should funds allow, we might get a second set of SD cards, so we can quickly re-task the cluster from one configuration to another.

What will we call it?

Probably not Ubuntu, because it isn't an official build of Ubuntu - and will probably have things that fail to build from source. We will need a name, maybe we will choose one, maybe someone will buy the naming rights perk!

FAQ

  • Why don't you get a bunch of fast PCs and cross compile?

It really needs to be built on the target architecture, that way packages that test themselves can run the tests in the right way. We also don't want a bunch of screamingly loud fans and lots of heat. The Raspberry Pi runs cool and silent, we think the price/performance is going to be OK too.

  • Why don't you use QEMU on cloud based computers and do it emulated?

Well that wouldn't be half as much fun.

  • What happens about packages that fail to build?

Depends why, if they fail to build due to lack of ram or disk space on a buildd then we can set up a beefier buildd with maybe an attached SSD and lots of swap, it might be slow but it should get there. If they fail to build because the code won't compile then we will probably just report a bug and leave it. We don't promise to build every single package.

  • What happens after it is done?

Well there is always more to build with a new Ubuntu distribution every 6 months. We would be very happy to use the cluster for other things too, if someone has a great idea and can give us some code to run on it then great, lets do that! It probably isn't going to be the future of Bitcoin mining, but if you want to do some experimental stuff that needs lots of modestly powered nodes then we are open to all suggestions. 

  • What if the campaign doesn't meet the target?

We will build a smaller cluster, it will take longer to build things, we might have to scale back the number of packages built, but we will still do something cool.

  • What is the VAT situation on this? Can I get an invoice?

Libertus Solutions is a UK company registered for VAT, we think that we will have to pay VAT on the money we get from Indiegogo, treating that as a sale of the pledges. Whether you have made a "purchase" by contributing is less clear. If you have an EU registered business and want to contribute to the project then we suggest you get in touch with us and we can directly invoice you for a pledge item so you can reclaim the VAT and it gets accounted for like any normal purchase.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donate your Pi!

If you have a Raspberry Pi that you bought with the intention to do something cool, but it is now sitting in a box all lonely and sad then we would gladly take it off your hands so it can enjoy doing some work with lots of friends! We will even pay for the postage. If you donate a Pi this way you get the naming rights for your pi, so you get to give it a hostname.

  • Help us set it up
If you have experience with building Debian based operating systems using wanna-build and buildd slaves or if you want to help fix packages that won't build from source then we would be delighted to have your assistance.

  • Tell people about this campaign!

Please do share this campaign on social networks and get the word out to anyone who might be interested in a build of Ubuntu for the Raspberry Pi. As more people contribute we can build a bigger faster cluster and get more done.

Who are we?

Just a bunch of folk, this project is not associated with either Canonical or the Raspberry Pi foundation, it is more of a grassroots community effort, some of us as individuals are involved in the Ubuntu project. Libertus Solutions is a consultancy company that provides support and advice for Free and Open Source software to businesses, occasionally using the Raspberry Pi platform as part of a solution. This is a bit of a side project, but we will put it through the company accounts so we pay all the right taxes and are all official and above board. We welcome additional help from anyone with an interest in the cluster.

story:
Summary

Being a full-time student, I have been developing 3D Protect in my spare time. I always had an interest in electronics, technology and programming - I studied Computer Science at A-Level and am familar with Java, C++, Python, Perl, PHP and MySQL Scripting. 3D Protect represents an application of these skills to a real life situation and hopefully will be able to help someone one day.

The app is part of a safety framework to effectively protect vulnerable or scared members of the public. I had encountered various 'SOS' type apps, but when tested, all were limited in terms of functionality and compatibility too. I developed other ideas, building on the 'Panic Button' foundations, adding new functions which make the app a fully featured location based application with geofenced check-ins, NFC integration, as well as the original panic features which will report the user's location to a secure website where reports will be mapped, viewable by any contacts nominated by the user.

Remember I am a full time student and so will be dedicating nearly all of my free time to this - I am dedicated to this concept and will ensure its success. The app is currently available from the Google Play store, the Windows Phoone Store, and soon iOS App Store. 

The funding I am seeking will enable further development of the software, as well as allowing me to develop 'SmartSafe' accessories -- Some will work with SmartPhones, such as the SmartSafe tags. Some will operate independently, but still integrate with the App. This side of the project is found in the SmartSafe Hub -- Designed for elderly or specialist care applications.

10% of the total raised will go to Rape Crisis UK, a charity supporting the victims of Rape and Sexual abuse in the United Kingdom.

The Product

Okay, you've heard about 3D Protect now, but what about these mysterious sounding 'hardware products' and 'smartsafe accessories'?

Well, the app was only ever intended to be the beginning of the story. The bigger picture includes a whole host of hardware options to offer maximum protection to all our customers. These range from the SmartSafe tags - NFC enabled stickers which allow you to check into Safe locations - to the SmartSafe Hub, designed for specialist and elderly care use. The hub consists of two elements - basically a transmitter and receiver. These can be configured in a number of ways - for example as exit control - to prevent residents leaving the premises unattended (a common problem in the case of specialist care for people suffering from Alzheimers disease and similar conditions).

What We Need & What You Get

The app has so far been very well received, gaining five star ratings on the Windows Phone 8 Store and receiving great feedback from workshops with testers.

To get to the next stage and deploy the hardware element, and turn my designs, sketches, diagrams and bizarre-looking prototypes into actual products, I need to purchase various electronic components, fabrication equipment, test equipment and develop cases etc with suppliers. Any surplus will go towards hosting, infrastructure and marketing costs. 10% of all funds raised will go to Rape Crisis UK

Perks will work as follows:

  • Under £5 - A personal newsletter providing regular project news and updates.
  • £5-10 - Free copy of the paid version of the software, plus personal newsletter.
  • £10-50 - Free copy of the paid version, personal newsletter and 3 Free NFC tags as well as a mention on our website.
  • Over £50 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' - You will also be optionally enrolled in future beta testing programs, for new software and hardware concepts.
  • Over £100 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' and ad-space for your website/product or blog.
  • Over £250 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' and ad-space for your website/product or blog. Free 3D Printed object of your choosing!
  • Over £500 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' and ad-space for your website/product or blog. Free 3D Printed object of your choosing! + FREE SmartSafe Hub + 1 SmartSafe Active Tag (Worth £150)!

Although it would be marvellous if the full funds could be raised - I have selected flexible funding, so any pledges will be redeemed even if the goal isn't met. Any contributions will be greatly appreciated and will go some way to getting these products out there!

The Impact

This project is important not just to me, but to society as a whole. I'm sure many, if not all, of you reading this will know someone who has at some point been in a vulnerable position, they may even have been raped or assaulted. My vision is to better protect these individuals using something virtually every person has in their pocket or handbag - their phone. I originally bought a mobile so I could let my parents know if my bus was going to be late, to prevent them from worrying. This is simply a rendition of that idea in the era of the smart phone, where it is so much more than a mere telephone - It has the potential to be a virtual body guard. Sending out an SOS of the nature this programme will allow would enable contacts to alert the emergency services if necessary, as well as collecting vital location evidence, which could potentially save a life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help! 
Please share this campaign on facebook, twitter - however you like, but please, spread the word and with your kind support, I can make this project happen.
story_txt:
SummaryBeing a full-time student, I have been developing 3D Protect in my spare time. I always had an interest in electronics, technology and programming - I studied Computer Science at A-Level and am familar with Java, C++, Python, Perl, PHP and MySQL Scripting. 3D Protect represents an application of these skills to a real life situation and hopefully will be able to help someone one day.The app is part of a safety framework to effectively protect vulnerable or scared members of the public. I had encountered various 'SOS' type apps, but when tested, all were limited in terms of functionality and compatibility too. I developed other ideas, building on the 'Panic Button' foundations, adding new functions which make the app a fully featured location based application with geofenced check-ins, NFC integration, as well as the original panic features which will report the user's location to a secure website where reports will be mapped, viewable by any contacts nominated by the user.Remember I am a full time student and so will be dedicating nearly all of my free time to this - I am dedicated to this concept and will ensure its success. The app is currently available from the Google Play store, the Windows Phoone Store, and soon iOS App Store. The funding I am seeking will enable further development of the software, as well as allowing me to develop 'SmartSafe' accessories -- Some will work with SmartPhones, such as the SmartSafe tags. Some will operate independently, but still integrate with the App. This side of the project is found in the SmartSafe Hub -- Designed for elderly or specialist care applications.10% of the total raised will go to Rape Crisis UK, a charity supporting the victims of Rape and Sexual abuse in the United Kingdom.The ProductOkay, you've heard about 3D Protect now, but what about these mysterious sounding 'hardware products' and 'smartsafe accessories'?Well, the app was only ever intended to be the beginning of the story. The bigger picture includes a whole host of hardware options to offer maximum protection to all our customers. These range from the SmartSafe tags - NFC enabled stickers which allow you to check into Safe locations - to the SmartSafe Hub, designed for specialist and elderly care use. The hub consists of two elements - basically a transmitter and receiver. These can be configured in a number of ways - for example as exit control - to prevent residents leaving the premises unattended (a common problem in the case of specialist care for people suffering from Alzheimers disease and similar conditions).What We Need & What You GetThe app has so far been very well received, gaining five star ratings on the Windows Phone 8 Store and receiving great feedback from workshops with testers.To get to the next stage and deploy the hardware element, and turn my designs, sketches, diagrams and bizarre-looking prototypes into actual products, I need to purchase various electronic components, fabrication equipment, test equipment and develop cases etc with suppliers. Any surplus will go towards hosting, infrastructure and marketing costs. 10% of all funds raised will go to Rape Crisis UK
Perks will work as follows:
Under £5 - A personal newsletter providing regular project news and updates.
£5-10 - Free copy of the paid version of the software, plus personal newsletter.
£10-50 - Free copy of the paid version, personal newsletter and 3 Free NFC tags as well as a mention on our website.
Over £50 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' - You will also be optionally enrolled in future beta testing programs, for new software and hardware concepts.
Over £100 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' and ad-space for your website/product or blog.
Over £250 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' and ad-space for your website/product or blog. Free 3D Printed object of your choosing!
Over £500 - Free copy of the paid version, 3 free NFC tags, newsletter, mention on our website as a 'top contributor' and ad-space for your website/product or blog. Free 3D Printed object of your choosing! + FREE SmartSafe Hub + 1 SmartSafe Active Tag (Worth £150)!
Although it would be marvellous if the full funds could be raised - I have selected flexible funding, so any pledges will be redeemed even if the goal isn't met. Any contributions will be greatly appreciated and will go some way to getting these products out there!The ImpactThis project is important not just to me, but to society as a whole. I'm sure many, if not all, of you reading this will know someone who has at some point been in a vulnerable position, they may even have been raped or assaulted. My vision is to better protect these individuals using something virtually every person has in their pocket or handbag - their phone. I originally bought a mobile so I could let my parents know if my bus was going to be late, to prevent them from worrying. This is simply a rendition of that idea in the era of the smart phone, where it is so much more than a mere telephone - It has the potential to be a virtual body guard. Sending out an SOS of the nature this programme will allow would enable contacts to alert the emergency services if necessary, as well as collecting vital location evidence, which could potentially save a life.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute, you can still help! Please share this campaign on facebook, twitter - however you like, but please, spread the word and with your kind support, I can make this project happen.

story:
Short Summary

Roommates is a smartphone social app dedicated to anyone chooses to live under the same roof. Roommates has been created to solve the problems raised by those cohabitations.  Who has never had a shitty roommate? Most of the time is hard to distinguish a good one from a bad one.

We want to solve those problems. The app in fact associates to every user a “Roommate-Gamer-Card” which is representative of the reputation and reliability of the user, so that you could check on a possible future roommate and choose if you want to rent him your free room.

You could also manage the house’s chores thanks to the social-side of the app and try to use the Roommates’ features to avoid silly fights with your pals.


What We Need

We started working on it as an android project, but soon we faced some difficulties. First of all we saw that we would need money for a solid server interface, for the server themselves and for the expenses of a proper working place.

For now we’re working in our garage (yes I know It’s a cliché but it’s true, unfortunately) and we’re trying to do as much as we can.

Without fund we could not improve some important features, such as an integrated ads system which could help users to publish for FREE their ads to search for a house or a roommate.

Without fund we could not develop a proper iOS version of the app, making the app worthless for the people who doesn’t possess an android device


What You Get

Thanks to the app you could get a better cohabitation with your roommates. No more fights. No more post it on the fridge to tell your roommate to empty the trash can. No more coming back home and find out there is an unauthorized party in your room.

Thanks to Roommates you could:

·  manage your shitty roommates

·  manage a chores calendar

·  vote your worst or best roommate with a reputation to warn his or her future roommates

·  improve your own reputation and show it to your landlord as a reference of your behavior

·  take the cohabitation as a game, where you could earn points for good behaviors


The Impact

Our project is important because we were students in Rome and, after years of forced cohabitations, we were tired of some people’s behavior. We were tired of living with people who didn’t want to clean the house, who didn’t remember to pay the bills. We were tired of people who ate your lunch for mistakes and tired of not having a place were we could check or even choose our roommates.

Of course, we are not asking money just for the sake of it.  We are already funding this by ourselves but we need help. We need help because after two whole years in Ericsson Italy, developing apps and videogame for big societies, we want to develop what we want, a project like this that we believe in.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help us, please share our page. Let your friends know about the project, ask them to help us. We’re making it, even if we have to work in a garage for our whole life, but it would be better (and faster) to do this with your help.

THANKS TO EVERYONE

story:
Hi there!

I'm Patty Jean Robinson, and like my father before me, I like to smash cars in an arena where people can cheer me on and have my blood boil just so I can smack the crap out of someone else's car. HULKSMASH ON WHEELS.

This campaign is to fund the building of a derby car so that I can participate this August in the 40th Annual Hangtown Destruction Derby in Placerville, CA.

Your donations will help me and my dad, (well mostly my dad and my brother), build an awesome derby car to smash and crash, and to get us to the derby.


We're Hoping to Raise $5,000

I had no idea how much it costs to build a derby car. All this time, my dad had access to used cars and borrowed equipment. Now that I want to do this on my own, I need some help as this stuff adds up! Here's a bit of a breakdown:

  • Car - $1000
  • Miller Welder -  $1,087.00
  • Gas bottle   -   $240.00
  • Welding cart  -  $150.00
  • Torches kit -  $245.00
  • Oxygen bottle -  $340.00
  • Acet Bottle -   $280.00
  • Car battery - $204.00(2 needed)     
  • Miscellaneous Parts (nuts/bolts etc,etc.) - $400.00
  • Car tires/rims  -  $500.00
  • Transportation/Gas/Food/Camping for a 3 day trip:  $800.00 (includes trailer rental)
  • Entry Fee to derby- $50.00
  • Tires for the car hauling truck-$600.00/$800.00
The parts/tires include other needed parts: radiator, bumpers(if needed), carburetor, distributor, oil, and that kind of stuff. If we raise $5,000 or more that will afford me a new firesuit and helmet, (instead of borrowing my brother's), a nifty paint job for the car, a pop up tent that will protect Dad & Rocky from the sun while they build the car. The more raised, the more Tools can be unlocked.

Perks

Well just what do you get in return? Aside from my never ending gratitude,

 

$5 - Thank you on Facebook and Twitter, and any other social media outlet I can get my hands on.

$10 - Thank you on The Internets & your name on my car!

$25 - Thanks, and you can ask a question from me or my dad, and get a video response.

$50 - Thanks, a video response from either my dad or me, and a 15 minute Google Hangout with us.

$75 - All of the above, a patch of the dragon that will hopefully be painted on Patty's car, made by Patty's Mom. Aww. 

$100 - All of the above and a dvd of the Big Day, shot and edited by my Awesome videographer of a brother, Rocky.

$150 - All of the above and tix for 2 to watch the derby in the grandstands. (Bring sun block as it is usually very sunny. But bring something just in case it rains.) You must provide your own transportation to Placerville, CA.

$200 All of the above and tix to the driver's pit area!! (You get to hang out and watch every one work on their cars and be up close and personal with the destruction. Ooooh).  If you go to the pits, you need to wear long pants and shoes. No sandals. Safety First! You must provide your own transportation to Placerville, CA.

$500.00 - All of the above and you can camp with us on Saturday night, (includes a bar-b-q that night, and a breakfast at the Veterans Hall the next morning. All part of our Placerville Derby Tradition). Good for 2 people for each donation.


$1000 - All of the above and you can help pre-bend my derby car. That's right, you can HulkSmash my car with a sledge hammer.


What happens if I don't make my goal?

If I'm unable to raise the $5k, I would like to use the funds raised to give back to the community. I would split it between
  • The Placerville Police Officer's Association - that's what the whole event is for
  • Red Cross - There's been so much going on lately.
  • If there's any leftover, I'd like to get my dad at least one new tire for his truck, as we blew one of them out going to the derby last year.

Why Is This So Important To You, Patty?

Because I have never known a greater thrill, a higher high, than to drive in a demolition derby. It's where I can turn into The Fearless Gladiator, look The Big Bad straight in the eye and yell, "COME ON YOU BITCH! COME ON!!!" (That's exactly what I did in 2009).

Why? Because last year, when I watched friends compete, my heart quickened, my adrenaline shot up, and I wanted to be in the arena so bad I could taste it. 

Why? Because it's the 40th anniversary of this particular derby. To me, it's like the Superbowl. I would get to be in the Superbowl!

Why? 'Cuz oftentimes, women don't compete at Placerville, or if they do, it's even more rare to come back. Dad was telling me he doesn''t remember seeing a woman return to Hangtown's derby.

Why? Because I never knew how f-ing expensive it is to build a car. 

In years past, my dad has had connections in getting a car, had his own equipment, and friends to call in favors to help him build a car. As Dad has retired, he sold what he had and whatever was leftover, he passed it on to friends. If I need Dad to build me a car, we need the cash to get it all. Basically, it's gonna cost anywhere from $5,000 to $7,000.

What if I fail? 

I really don't like that phrase. It plagues me all the time. It's held me back more often than not. I'm really tired of living in fear of WHAT IF. 

Here's me declaring my intentions to raise $5000-$7000. To build a car to drive in a destruction derby. (You can say demolition derby, but I really like the destruction aspect of it all). 

While Dad is helping with the car, my brother Rocky is helping me with the videos and the outreach. He's gonna make it look way cooler than I ever could. I figure with our combined forces, it's very likely that we could kick some ass and have fun!

Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you can't kick in. Trust me, I get it. All I ask is that you share, share, share. As videos come out, and blogs get posted, please share in whichever way you can. This is a wild and crazy ride, and I really appreciate you joining me. Let's see what we kind of ruckus we can create, shall we?

story:
We first started out at a different crowdfunding site and received an overwhelming response and there where many people that missed the deadline so we decided to run InDemand here at Indiegogo and give more people the opportunity to Pre-Order at a discounted price. Please read our story and contact us if you have any questions. We hope you will find MOVE to be as awesome as we do and we hope you will join us in the journey bringing it to market.

Over 10,000 units is already sold. Make sure to pre order and get a great deal before its to late!

Visit also our website  www.teptron.com

Universal application  

MOVE is built to fit as many different manually operated indoor blinds and shades as possible that has a cord or bead chain. MOVE can be controlled directly by a smartphone or automated based on time, temperature or solar conditions.


Super easy to install  

Anybody can easily and quickly install MOVE without the need of craftsman or electrician. Its housing is either fastened using wall bracket or dual side tape. The housing contains the necessary batteries. Solar panel for battery charging included. No connection to electrical outlets necessary.  







Rise and shine!  

Use the timer function and wake up to natural light. Every MOVE unit can be set individually which means that you can set multiple time schedules of your own choice.



Movie time  

If you want the livingroom to be dark just sit back, relax, and push the button in your app. Tada! Let the excitement begin.


Once you finished your movie the regular settings will be re-applied automatically.


Controlled inner climate

Wouldn’t it be nice if your blinds and shades would react to sunshine or temperature? MOVE does all that for you! 

Activate the settings and your windows will be shaded automatically, making it cooler and protected from strong sunshine. When the sun is clouded or goes down, the window shades will open up again.


Fully controlled

All settings are managed in the app and MOVE can be controlled directly by a smartphone or automated based on time, temperature or solar conditions.


A basic schedule is easy to set for every MOVE unit and will be remembered even if temporary motions are performed by you manually. This way MOVE will always open and close the blinds according to your settings while also allowing you to sometimes run them by the app. The app will initially be launched to Android and iOS followed thereafter by a Windows Phone app.


Inside MOVE technology

MOVE uses a CSR1010 module with Bluetooth Smart, the module have CSRmesh radio which is a mesh protocol running over Bluetooth Smart. This means multiple units can communicate with each other forwarding transmissions making the radio coverage better. This also makes it possible to link MOVE units together making them act as one.


We have put a lot of time into designing and testing the custom metal gearbox. Our goal has been to make it very powerful yet as quiet as possible. In order to ensure its function even under heavy load the gears are made of metal and the output axel has dual bearings. The motor is controlled with back EMF which is a way of determining the rpm of the motor, thanks to this it's possible to calibrate endpoints. MOVE also have a force limiting safety feature making it safe to use.

MOVE is pretty strong.

MOVE will have a open API to the hardware making it possible for anyone to tweak it into a existing home automation systems or just make a own cool control app.


Making MOVE go

We wanted MOVE to be as easy as possible to install out of the box so we made MOVE run on standard batteries (4 x AAA) as default and by using our included solar panel in combination with rechargeable batteries MOVE will become self-sufficient.

MOVE can also be installed with permanent power by using a USB port power supply with a micro USB cable (not included).  


Specification  

Power: Battery 4xAAA (not included), AC adapter (not included)  
Radio protocol: Bluetooth Smart
MCU chip: CSR1010
Motor torque: ≈1Nm
Reel mechanism: Spool and cogwheel 
Weight: 213g 
Size: Length 154mm, with 32mm, height 28mm 


In the package when delivered 

1x MOVE unit 
1x Solar panel 
2x Reels (spool and cogwheel)
1x Wall mount 
1x Double-sided tape
1x User manual


Why did we make MOVE?

A while back we were on the lookout for a motor that could motorize existing indoor blinds and shades. Although nearly all home automation companies uses motorized blinds and shades we could not find anything that could be retrofitted. The only options we found would force the replacement of existing products for new expensive ones. Furthermore you need to hire an electrician to have it installed. We thought there should be a better way, so we made -MOVE.

Our goal was very clear! ”Produce a motor that is universal, affordable, simple to install and multi-functional!”

Timeline  

November 2014- Start designing gearbox  
December 2014- First and second prototype built 
January 2015- Endurance test of the gear motor 
February 2015- Circuit board test 
Mars 2015- Tests of solar panels 
April 2015- Enhancements of gear motor setup 
Maj 2015- Second endurance test of the gear motor 
June 2015- Finalize 3D files of plastic parts 
July 2015- Start campaign
August 2015- End campaign, prepare certification tests
September 2015- Make all certifications (CE, FCC and others) 
October 2015- Finalize software, app and order plastic molds 
November 2015- Finalize packaging, receive first batch plastic parts
December 2015- Make first batch of MOVE 
January 2016- Start production 
April 2016- Start shipping MOVE to you, our backers 


Risks and challenges

We are a small company and small companies can be faced with difficulties when it comes to manufacturing a new product. Problems and costs may come up that are unexpected for us. We have done all we can do before launching this campaign to remove stumbling blocks. We now have our ducks in row for starting manufacturing according to our Timeline.

We will keep you informed during the process and let you know where we are at.
