story:
Table of Contents

  • Short Summary
  • What I Need, and What You Get
  • Impact
  • Impact (not-so-serious)
  • Risks and Challenges
  • Other Ways You Can Help
  • How it Works
    • Overview
    • Content Types
    • Services
    • Global Settings
  • Ideas
  • Technical Details
  • Contact
  • Credits

Short Summary

Sinookas is a private content-delivery platform you host yourself that unlocks the GPS-potential of your mobile devices without having to trust or depend on third-party services. It's a two-part system, an open-source web interface and a commercial mobile application, that allows you to replicate and customize common tasks, both single- and multi-user, found in many of today's popular apps, including but not-by-any-means limited to:

  • Messengers
  • Geocaching
  • Shopping lists
  • Daily Planners
  • Tour guides
  • Map services
  • Trackers

Sinookas takes advantage of the fact that many content-driven applications are very similar from a functional perspective. The major differences are things like how content is viewed, who can create content, how are pieces of content related, and in many cases simply what content is called. In other words, they are rehashed and repackaged ideas.

Sinookas abstracts these differences away giving you the control to create your own services and customize the behavior, look, and feel of your mobile device via a browser interface. It is flexible and highly configurable, but it's only as complicated as you want it to be. There are increasing levels of involvement from running a turn-key application that you never think about or touch all the way on down to manually extending the platform programmatically. See below for more details.

Because the backend is open-source, you can host an instance yourself anywhere you'd like. Connections to your server or any other Sinookas provider are direct, so nothing is ever routed through a central server, meaning you control and own your own data. Under certain configurations, an internet connection isn't even required.

This is a service that I've wanted to exist for a few years, so I've finally decided to do it myself.

Anyway, I hope you're as excited as I am and thanks for reading this far!

Back to the top

What I Need & What You Get

I've already been working on the project for 3 months, so a lot of progress has been made. Other than slight tweaks here-and-there, the web interface/backend is complete. I've built a quick prototype for Android™ to test the content creation and retrieval mechanisms so I know I can deliver Sinookas in a realistic time frame.

I've paid for hosting, domains, and TLS/SSL certificates, so the $5,041 goal will cover the cost of the bare minimum viable product, primarily going towards development time and covering the following:

  • Shipping the Sinookas platform, both the web and Android applications
  • Increasing test coverage to 90-95% (currently at 67% for the web application and ~40% for the mobile application)
  • Writing setup and usage instructions
  • Creating video tutorials
  • Finishing the developer documentation
  • Seeking legal counsel

Because so much more can be done to improve Sinookas, the perks are arranged in a modular way giving you influence over the direction the platform will take once the first stage is complete. Think of them as a voting system.

These are what I am putting the highest priority on, in no particular order:

  • Creating a Windows Phone app
  • Creating an iOS app
  • Building an "installer"

Lower-priority features I would like to implement eventually:

  • Subscription/payment hooks so you have the option to earn money with a service you create
  • Sign in to multiple services from multiple hosts simultaneously
  • Integrate content with a publicly facing web view

Each of these features and goals have a corresponding $1 perk that behaves simply as a vote and a more expensive perk that unconditionally determines the next phases Sinookas will take. The upper-tier perks will be honored in a first-come basis and will trump the voting system. However I believe strongly in listening to users' requests and will otherwise prioritize further development according to the voting results. (One exception is the iOS app which will only be honored if the cost of an OSx computer is covered).

Other things I'm considering doing if enough interest is expressed:

  • Creating a Wordpress plugin
  • Porting the backend to Ruby on Rails

Should the project not reach its goal, I will still finish the project because this is something I want to use, but I can't guarantee when it will be launched. And of course I will keep any backers updated on progress being made.

Back to the top

The Impact (Serious version)

Sinookas is important for those who are concerned about privacy and wish to minimize their digital footprint without sacrificing the advantages technology brings. At such an early stage in the globalized, interconnected era, it's difficult, if not impossible, to predict what effect such open and easy access to our personal data will have. There's often a trade-off between protecting ourselves and our data and taking advantage of the tools and services that pop up so quickly in this age.

On one hand, keeping up with the terms and service (TOS) of one application as it changes is difficult enough. Keeping up with the terms and services of all your applications (Web, mobile, desktop, wearable, vehicular, etc) with all their affiliated legal documents approaches on the impossible.

On the other hand and regardless of TOS, sites get hacked. People get doxxed. Information is leaked. These things aren't necessarily malicious, but accidents happen.

Sinookas makes it so you don't have to choose between privacy/security and technology. The only person you have to trust to keep your information and your family's information safe is yourself--well, and maybe your web host depending on how you set things up.

Back to the top

The Impact (Not-so-serious version)

While it's great for all the security-minded reasons above, it's not all doom-and-gloom! In fact Sinookas originated as the engine of a kid's book I'm writing.

Aside from plenty of single-user tasks, it's also intended for multiple users: think private services for you and your friends or colleagues what you might not want the rest of the world to see ;-)

Be creative. There's lots of ways you can make Sinookas stupid and/or fun :)

Back to the top

Risks & Challenges

Because of the nature of Sinookas, there is nothing really groundbreaking about its functionality, so the technological hurdles are minimal. It's not a matter of whether these things are possible, it's a matter of when they will be finished. And as I mentioned above, I've already finished the backend and started on the mobile app. So conservatively, I'm confident I can release Sinookas by May. In a worse case scenario with unforeseen difficulties, I would release a beta version to the backers at that time.

I've never developed for Windows Phone or iOS. To be honest I've never even programmed in C# or Objective-C--the languages required by those platforms, respectively. So there will be a bit of overhead as I port Sinookas to those operating systems. For those of you with no programming experience, that's not nearly as problematic as it sounds. It's common to have to switch to new languages for different projects. (As a comparison, the first time I ever tried developing for Android, I was able to turn my phone into audio controls for my PC in about 6 hours including download, installation, and reading documentation).

For the developers interested in extending the platform, I got the idea at a late stage to use HTTP Options to transmit meta-information about how fields should be rendered on the frontend. It's very basic at the moment, mostly just data type and whether a field is required or not when creating or updating. A more useful implementation will require a fairly significant refactoring which I don't plan to do for the first release.

Back to the top

Other Ways You Can Help

It's contrived, but spread the word! It really does help. Don't be afraid to share the campaign page.

Invite me to do an AMA, casual or official. That'd be fun. I like answering questions and elaborating about what isn't clear.

If you're going to sign-up for an account on Webfaction, which I highly recommend, use my affiliate id: mcclure

Here's a link: https://www.webfaction.com/signup?aid=mcclure

Back to the top

How it works

(Videos demonstrations will be uploaded soon.)

Overview

In the most simple case, a user follows a three-step setup wizard, optionally skipping the second step, and selects from a list of 10 preset configurations to setup a working app with minimal effort in a matter of minutes.

More involved users can use the default services as templates, tweak the behavior, mix and match parts as they desire, or even skip the wizard all together and try building a service by hand from the ground up.

Developers will have the opportunity to extend the platform even further by taking advantage of hooks to create their own data models and queries then registering them with the API. The administration panel will detect them automatically and include further configuration, display, and settings options.

The truly adventurous won't even need to use the backend at all. The documentation will specify everything you need in case you want to start from scratch and communicate directly with the mobile app.

Content Types

Sinookas is a content-driven application, so most of its power and flexibility comes from fine-tuning the behavior of content. There are currently three categories:

  • Content: this is the core piece of, well, content. Often it is the center-point of a service
    Examples: messages, ingredients, historical sites
  • Content Groups: these are exactly what they sound like: groups of content.
    Examples: conversations, recipes, tour guides
  • Meta-Content: content about/connected to other content or content groups.
    Examples: Away messages, tips, warnings

These categories are essentially text, geospatial information, and a file attachment with some additional information for each. You also find other attributes commonly found with digital data like the author, time-date information (publish, expiration, and deletion dates), who can view the content, who has viewed it, view counts, visibility rules, and some others.

You tailor the behavior by creating specific instances of each category, called Content Types, where you define default values and control what users can see and edit. It's a ridiculously simple idea, but a lot of "different" services and tasks can be squeezed out by changing minor things.

For example, take a shopping list, just a group of food items. It's a very basic Content Group. By allowing other people to contribute, the shopping list becomes dynamic so your family or roommates can add to it from wherever they are. But any list that accepts input from multiple users is functionally no different than a private messenger service. Because we're consenting adults, all it takes is to just rename "shopping list" and "food item" to "conversation" and "message" to create the illusion of a different service. There are more subtle changes you can make to improve the user experience, but this is just a demonstration.

Then by enabling GPS-data for each of these, your shopping list alerts you to pick something up as you walk by a store and a location-dependent messenger where you continue conversations based on where you are.

Alternatively, requiring users to provide publish and expiration dates shifts the behavior from geospatial notifications to temporal ones, or in other words, a reminder system, the basis for daily planners, todo lists, project management, calendars. etc. etc.

Little tweaks open up lots of possibilities. Be creative. Ask yourself questions. What effect does adding users to a service have? What could a a maximum view count be used for? Does changing the order of content matter? What happens when all messages have the same value for X? What do you get when you limit titles to 140 characters? What happens when all content has a required duration after which it is no longer available? Why would I want all active users to be visible on the map?

Services

Once the content types are set up, you build your service. These are more general rules that tie everything together. You can require all activity to take place in certain geographic reasons, and if so, whether the map should be viewable. You set how often users can search and how fast users can travel--intended to protect against cheating and bots but maybe there are other uses?

Under certain circumstances users are considered to be a special type of content, so here you can define what should be visible and editable.

It's also where you include and exclude the content types you've created. You determine whether users can create content or just read it. For geospatial content, you define how far away a user must be to detect content.

You also have the opportunity to change the color scheme and some labels here.

Global Settings

Each Sinookas server can run multiple services simultaneously. Global settings are rules that apply to all of your services (e.g., the name of your server, a description, terms of service[if applicable], permissible file types to be uploaded, virus scanning policy), dictate what happens before a user logs in or registers (Design settings, registration methods) and where they are directed once they login.

Back to the top

Ideas

These are just some multi-user services I would like people to create:

  • Local history guides/tours for cities, towns, and regions
  • Neighborhood watches
  • GPS guide to fiction that takes place in real locations (e.g., On the Road, and Confederacy of Dunces), with chapters mapped to where they may have taken place
  • Location-based news
  • Boycotts
  • Archaeology excavation aides
  • GEO-blogging
  • Human Trackers/Visual aids for sports that take place over large areas: paintball, cross country, mountain biking.

Back to the top

Technical Details

Backend/Web Interface

  • Python 2.7 and 3.4+ compatible
  • Built with Django 1.8+
  • Features a browsable REST-API that uses the JSON format
  • Optionally uses the Nominatim service from Open Street Maps to retrieve boundary definitions when trying to create regions from text descriptions

Mobile Application

  • Compatible with Android 2.3+
  • Requires Google Play Services to be installed (for now) for efficient location handling
  • Required Dangerous Permissions:
    • Group (Permission(s)): explanation
    • Camera (CAMERA): for users to upload images and videos
    • Location (ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION, ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION): it's a GPS app :)
    • Microphone (RECORD_AUDIO): so users can upload audio files
    • Storage (READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE): so users can upload files

Database

  • PostgreSQL is required for certain database fields
  • PostGIS extension

Security and privacy

  • TLS/SSL is required
  • Password encryption: sha256, pbkdf2 algorithm, 12,000 iterations, 12 character salt
  • Authorization tokens: sha128, 15 day expiration, 128 character digest, 16 character salt
  • Multiple tokens are issued per user per request and can be revoked simultaneously
  • Developers may change password and token implementation details as they see fit
  • Files are scanned for malicious content using ClamAV
  • File types are verified by the magic number file signature

Back to the top

Contact

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sinookasplatform/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/sinookasldm
IRC: jonky@freenode
Github: https://github.com/brmc/

Back to the top

Credits

Thanks to Model Human, a duo from New Orleans, for providing the music. Please check them out. Not everything they do sounds like it was written for a commercial :)
http://www.model-human.com/

Back to the top

Legal stuff

Android is a trademark of Google Inc.

The Android robot is reproduced or modified from work created and shared by Google and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 3.0 Attribution License.

Back to the top

Table of Contents 

Short Summary
What I Need, and What You Get
Impact 
Impact (not-so-serious)
Risks and Challenges
Other Ways You Can Help

How it Works

Overview
Content Types
Services
Global Settings


Ideas
Technical Details
Contact
Credits




Short Summary 
Sinookas is a private content-delivery platform you host yourself that unlocks the GPS-potential of your mobile devices without having to trust or depend on third-party services. It's a two-part system, an open-source web interface and a commercial mobile application, that allows you to replicate and customize common tasks, both single- and multi-user, found in many of today's popular apps, including but not-by-any-means limited to:

Messengers
Geocaching
Shopping lists
Daily Planners
Tour guides
Map services
Trackers

Sinookas takes advantage of the fact that many content-driven applications are very similar from a functional perspective. The major differences are things like how content is viewed, who can create content, how are pieces of content related, and in many cases simply what content is called. In other words, they are rehashed and repackaged ideas.
Sinookas abstracts these differences away giving you the control to create your own services and customize the behavior, look, and feel of your mobile device via a browser interface. It is flexible and highly configurable, but it's only as complicated as you want it to be. There are increasing levels of involvement from running a turn-key application that you never think about or touch all the way on down to manually extending the platform programmatically. See below for more details.
Because the backend is open-source, you can host an instance yourself anywhere you'd like. Connections to your server or any other Sinookas provider are direct, so nothing is ever routed through a central server, meaning you control and own your own data. Under certain configurations, an internet connection isn't even required.
This is a service that I've wanted to exist for a few years, so I've finally decided to do it myself.
Anyway, I hope you're as excited as I am and thanks for reading this far!
Back to the top


 What I Need & What You Get

I've already been working on the project for 3 months, so a lot of progress has been made. Other than slight tweaks here-and-there, the web interface/backend is complete. I've built a quick prototype for Android™ to test the content creation and retrieval mechanisms so I know I can deliver Sinookas in a realistic time frame.
I've paid for hosting, domains, and TLS/SSL certificates, so the $5,041 goal will cover the cost of the bare minimum viable product, primarily going towards development time and covering the following:

Shipping the Sinookas platform, both the web and Android applications
Increasing test coverage to 90-95% (currently at 67% for the web application and ~40% for the mobile application)
Writing setup and usage instructions
Creating video tutorials
Finishing the developer documentation
Seeking legal counsel

Because so much more can be done to improve Sinookas, the perks are arranged in a modular way giving you influence over the direction the platform will take once the first stage is complete. Think of them as a voting system. 
These are what I am putting the highest priority on, in no particular order:

Creating a Windows Phone app
Creating an iOS app
Building an "installer"

Lower-priority features I would like to implement eventually:

Subscription/payment hooks so you have the option to earn money with a service you create
Sign in to multiple services from multiple hosts simultaneously
Integrate content with a publicly facing web view

Each of these features and goals have a corresponding $1 perk that behaves simply as a vote and a more expensive perk that unconditionally determines the next phases Sinookas will take. The upper-tier perks will be honored in a first-come basis and will trump the voting system. However I believe strongly in listening to users' requests and will otherwise prioritize further development according to the voting results. (One exception is the iOS app which will only be honored if the cost of an OSx computer is covered).
Other things I'm considering doing if enough interest is expressed:

Creating a Wordpress plugin
Porting the backend to Ruby on Rails

Should the project not reach its goal, I will still finish the project because this is something I want to use, but I can't guarantee when it will be launched. And of course I will keep any backers updated on progress being made.
Back to the top


 The Impact (Serious version)

Sinookas is important for those who are concerned about privacy and wish to minimize their digital footprint without sacrificing the advantages technology brings. At such an early stage in the globalized, interconnected era, it's difficult, if not impossible, to predict what effect such open and easy access to our personal data will have. Sinookas makes it so you don't have to choose between privacy/security and technology. The only person you have to trust to keep your information and your family's information safe is yourself--well, and maybe your web host depending on how you set things up.
Back to the top


 The Impact (Not-so-serious version)

While it's great for all the security-minded reasons above, it's not all doom-and-gloom! In fact Sinookas originated as the engine of a kid's book I'm writing.
Aside from plenty of single-user tasks, it's also intended for multiple users: think private services for you and your friends or colleagues what you might not want the rest of the world to see ;-) 
Be creative. There's lots of ways you can make Sinookas stupid and/or fun :)

I've never developed for Windows Phone or iOS. To be honest I've never even programmed in C# or Objective-C--the languages required by those platforms, respectively. story:
Are You Fed Up with Frozen Pipes That Burst In Winter or a Hot Summer Home That Has You Roasting When You Arrive?


Sense takes care of all of that giving anyone the ability to change the temperature of anything that has power to heat and cold. You can also turn lights on and off to give would-be burglars the impression someone is around - so they move on to an easier target where it's obvious nobody is home.  And you do it all from your phone.

If you own a weekend home and like getting away for a weekend you know what kind of nightmares you face, if the heating system fails water pipes start to freeze then eventually burst causing very expensive flood damage.

Things are just as bad in summer. Getting away for a summer weekend at your weekend home and opening the front door is like opening a blast furnace as a blast of hot air hits you like a punch in the face. And even though your summer home feels like a weekend in hell - the water in your swimming pool is probably ice cold. Not the best way to start kick off a fun weekend, is it?


Solution? Sense. Not only can you control temperature settings, you can check the temperature at any time too! Even better, Sense will send an alert to your phone if the temperature at the Sense location changes dramatically.

Heading out for a day of hiking? Cool! Make sure your RV is cool by sending a simple signal to turn down the air conditioning so you come back to a cool place to relax. Just send a simple command to Sense and it'll turn on the air conditioner to make sure your RV is cool and comfortable by the time you return.

There are dozens of applications for Sense that include remote alarm monitoring, controlling various electrical devices like outdoor garden fountains, security lighting, fans and so much more.

With Sense on the job it's like having a 24 hour security and maintenance team on duty in your home, on your boat, in your RV or camper or even out on your pool or Jacuzzi deck.

If you're not amazed yet, then consider this!

ALL of this functionality is achieved WITHOUT an Internet Connection!

How is This Possible? How Can Sense Do All of This? How Does Sense Work?

This diagram shows you how Sense operates in a house and what it's capable of doing once installed.  Similar principles apply to campers, boats and even swimming pools.

Here's how you control Sense from your phone:

Sense is easy to install by anybody and easy to control from anywhere.

What We Need & What You Get

Sense is developed, tested and now we want to make it avaialable for YOU!

  • We need your help, so we can start with production, which is the driving force behind this crowdfunding campaign.
  • When we hit our $75,000 funding goal we'll thank our backers with very generous pricing on Sense of up to 30% off regular price.
  • If we fall short of our funding goal we will apply all of the funds raised to promotion and marketing of Sense to everybody around the world as much as is possible.

Frequently Asked Questions

How does SENSE communicate?

SENSE is controlled via a mobile APP that uses SMS commands for exchanging information between SENSE and your mobile phone. SENSE does not require the Internet connection and can be accessed in limited areas such as mountains, lakes or other rural areas. Thanks to this you will also save money on data services, especially when you are abroad.

Why do I need GPS/GLONASS localization?

Thanks to GPS and GLONASS high quality antenna and chip, you will know exactly where your object (caravan, yacht,..) is located. You can use Guard functionality to receive notification whenever your object changes its position real time! Or even more, you can use it to easily navigate to your object's current location!

What happens if caravan/boat battery voltage drops?

SENSE is constantly monitoring input voltage and therefore you can set Voltage level alert to get a notification whenever your system is running on low power! SENSE has 4xAA batteries (not included in package), so even in case your power supply is completely off, you can still get notified!

How accurate SENSE measures temperature?

SENSE is using precise digital temperature sensors in a small waterproof case for temperature measurement. SENSE is designed to measure two temperatures and gives you the option to set required hysteresis.

How SENSE temperature control works?

Based on first temperature sensor input, SENSE operates heating and cooling outputs to achieve desired temperature, while taking into account hysteresis. Second temperature sensor input is used for ambient temperature measurement and for antifreeze notification.

What kinds of temperature control modes are possible with SENSE?

SENSE can operate heating and cooling in automatic mode, timer mode or manual control mode. In automatic mode, you can enjoy temperature as you set it up. Timer mode gives you option to specify when heating or cooling should be active. Manual mode gives you complete control over heater and cooler control.

How can I use AUX?

SENSE is capable of operating 2 individual power outputs, each with manual or timer mode. This gives you the ability to operate boiler, lights, garden fountain, fan or anything else that you would like to turn on and off remotely or by the timer. Please keep in mind the technical limits of the outputs.

Alarm functionality, what does it mean for SENSE?

Do you like to get notification to your phone when something is happening? SENSE has potential free contact port where you can connect sensors such as door or window magnetic contact, warning output of some electronics and so on.

Does SENSE have antifreeze function?

Yes, you can setup alarm threshold and when temperature drops below, you will get notification to your phone!

Is it possible to install SENSE to existing systems?

For sure! It is possible to connect SENSE to nearly all systems and installations. With installation manual which is part of the package, you will find easy to read connection schema that will guide you through. If you have some doubts, please let us know via contact form.

What kind of power supply is needed?

SENSE is working with 12V power input. You can use direct connection from your caravan/boat electrical system or use power adapter that suits your country specification and provide 12VDC@1A power.

What is included in the package?

In a package, you can find SENSE, 2x temperature sensors, GPS/GLONASS & GSM combined external antenna, installation and user manual.

Why isn't the adapter a standard part of the package?

ISA watches every aspect of environmental protection within its products / packages. Before you add this accessory, please check at home, perhaps you might have an unused adapter for SENSE available :-). Thank you.

Where can I find the mobile application?&

Mobile application for iOS and Android systems, which will be free of any charge, will be publicly available when in August 2016.

How can I install it myself?

Installation has to be performed according to installation manual. Installation can be performed by medium technically skilled person. When in doubts, please ask electrician to install it. Please always check and follow your local regulations.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks or challenges. Sense is a reality and has been tested in homes, boats and campers across Europe.

Wrote about US

Slovak startup comunity portal www.startitup.sk


Czech startup comunity portal www.startupisti.cz


Press release @ www.releasewire.com


Press release @ www.einpresswire.com


About US

ISA – Innovative Solutions Atelier is active in SMART and INNOVATIVE niche markets. We develop, manufacture, license and market innovative solutions, products and services which prove to provide new market standards and maximum value to our customers. We analyse various markets, value chains and customer needs in variety of geographies or segments, we develop build, test and deploy inventions with creative solutions for future-proof products.Specialties: Product research & development, Creative marketing, Product management, Industrial and smart automation, Home automation and KNX, Smart control systems, B2B and B2C sales channels implementation, Hosting development projects, Project management (international & cross domain)

Our company website.
story_txt:
Are You Fed Up with Frozen Pipes That Burst In Winter or a Hot Summer Home That Has You Roasting When You Arrive?



Sense takes care of all of that giving anyone the ability to change the temperature of anything that has power to heat and cold. You can also turn lights on and off to give would-be burglars the impression someone is around - so they move on to an easier target where it's obvious nobody is home.  And you do it all from your phone.









If you own a weekend home and like getting away for a weekend you know what kind of nightmares you face, if the heating system fails water pipes start to freeze then eventually burst causing very expensive flood damage.



Things are just as bad in summer. Getting away for a summer weekend at your weekend home and opening the front door is like opening a blast furnace as a blast of hot air hits you like a punch in the face. And even though your summer home feels like a weekend in hell - the water in your swimming pool is probably ice cold. Not the best way to start kick off a fun weekend, is it?








Solution? Sense. Not only can you control temperature settings, you can check the temperature at any time too! Even better, Sense will send an alert to your phone if the temperature at the Sense location changes dramatically.

Heading out for a day of hiking? Cool! Make sure your RV is cool by sending a simple signal to turn down the air conditioning so you come back to a cool place to relax. Just send a simple command to Sense and it'll turn on the air conditioner to make sure your RV is cool and comfortable by the time you return.

There are dozens of applications for Sense that include remote alarm monitoring, controlling various electrical devices like outdoor garden fountains, security lighting, fans and so much more.

With Sense on the job it's like having a 24 hour security and maintenance team on duty in your home, on your boat, in your RV or camper or even out on your pool or Jacuzzi deck.



If you're not amazed yet, then consider this!
ALL of this functionality is achieved WITHOUT an Internet Connection!







How is This Possible? How Can Sense Do All of This? How Does Sense Work?


This diagram shows you how Sense operates in a house and what it's capable of doing once installed.  Similar principles apply to campers, boats and even swimming pools.








Here's how you control Sense from your phone:







Sense is easy to install by anybody and easy to control from anywhere.




What We Need & What You Get



Sense is developed, tested and now we want to make it avaialable for YOU!

We need your help, so we can start with production, which is the driving force behind this crowdfunding campaign.

When we hit our $75,000 funding goal we'll thank our backers with very generous pricing on Sense of up to 30% off regular price.

If we fall short of our funding goal we will apply all of the funds raised to promotion and marketing of Sense to everybody around the world as much as is possible.











Frequently Asked Questions



How does SENSE communicate?
SENSE is controlled via a mobile APP that uses SMS commands for exchanging information between SENSE and your mobile phone. SENSE does not require the Internet connection and can be accessed in limited areas such as mountains, lakes or other rural areas. Thanks to this you will also save money on data services, especially when you are abroad.
 Why do I need GPS/GLONASS localization?
Thanks to GPS and GLONASS high quality antenna and chip, you will know exactly where your object (caravan, yacht,..) is located. You can use Guard functionality to receive notification whenever your object changes its position real time! Or even more, you can use it to easily navigate to your object's current location!
What happens if caravan/boat battery voltage drops?
SENSE is constantly monitoring input voltage and therefore you can set Voltage level alert to get a notification whenever your system is running on low power! SENSE has 4xAA batteries (not included in package), so even in case your power supply is completely off, you can still get notified!








How accurate SENSE measures temperature?
SENSE is using precise digital temperature sensors in a small waterproof case for temperature measurement. SENSE is designed to measure two temperatures and gives you the option to set required hysteresis.
How SENSE temperature control works?
Based on first temperature sensor input, SENSE operates heating and cooling outputs to achieve desired temperature, while taking into account hysteresis. Second temperature sensor input is used for ambient temperature measurement and for antifreeze notification.
What kinds of temperature control modes are possible with SENSE?
SENSE can operate heating and cooling in automatic mode, timer mode or manual control mode. In automatic mode, you can enjoy temperature as you set it up. Timer mode gives you option to specify when heating or cooling should be active. Manual mode gives you complete control over heater and cooler control.
How can I use AUX?
SENSE is capable of operating 2 individual power outputs, each with manual or timer mode. This gives you the ability to operate boiler, lights, garden fountain, fan or anything else that you would like to turn on and off remotely or by the timer. Please keep in mind the technical limits of the outputs.
Alarm functionality, what does it mean for SENSE?
Do you like to get notification to your phone when something is happening? SENSE has potential free contact port where you can connect sensors such as door or window magnetic contact, warning output of some electronics and so on.
Does SENSE have antifreeze function?
Yes, you can setup alarm threshold and when temperature drops below, you will get notification to your phone!







Is it possible to install SENSE to existing systems?
For sure! It is possible to connect SENSE to nearly all systems and installations. With installation manual which is part of the package, you will find easy to read connection schema that will guide you through. If you have some doubts, please let us know via contact form.
What kind of power supply is needed?
SENSE is working with 12V power input. You can use direct connection from your caravan/boat electrical system or use power adapter that suits your country specification and provide 12VDC@1A power.
What is included in the package?
In a package, you can find SENSE, 2x temperature sensors, GPS/GLONASS & GSM combined external antenna, installation and user manual.
Why isn't the adapter a standard part of the package?
ISA watches every aspect of environmental protection within its products / packages. Before you add this accessory, please check at home, perhaps you might have an unused adapter for SENSE available :-). Thank you.
Where can I find the mobile application?&
Mobile application for iOS and Android systems, which will be free of any charge, will be publicly available when in August 2016.
How can I install it myself?
Installation has to be performed according to installation manual. Installation can be performed by medium technically skilled person. When in doubts, please ask electrician to install it. Please always check and follow your local regulations.









Risks & Challenges
There are no risks or challenges. Sense is a reality and has been tested in homes, boats and campers across Europe.




Wrote about US


Slovak startup comunity portal www.startitup.sk




Czech startup comunity portal www.startupisti.cz




Press release @ www.releasewire.com



Press release @ www.einpresswire.com







About US




ISA – Innovative Solutions Atelier is active in SMART and INNOVATIVE niche markets. We develop, manufacture, license and market innovative solutions, products and services which prove to provide new market standards and maximum value to our customers. We analyse various markets, value chains and customer needs in variety of geographies or segments, we develop build, test and deploy inventions with creative solutions for future-proof products.Specialties: Product research & development, Creative marketing, Product management, Industrial and smart automation, Home automation and KNX, Smart control systems, B2B and B2C sales channels implementation, Hosting development projects, Project management (international & cross domain)
Our company website.

story:
Quality timepieces designed in Bay Area, California. With premium components at affordable prices, each and every watch is made to last for years to come. After dedicating two years of hard work towards bringing this project to life, we are ready to share our vision with the world.
We are ATLAS.

 

 

 

OUR STORY

Inspiring you to live your life to the fullest is what we do.
Live your journey with watches that tell your story.

 

 

Here at ATLAS, we focus on products that keep count of every valuable second you spend. Our brand is driven by the fact that time is a universal possession and belongs to everyone. What makes each of us different is in the way we choose to spend it. As with life's redefining moments, quality is timeless. We aspire to inspire people to push the envelope and attempt at being more than they are every day.

As the motto goes- "Time is what you make of it." We wanted to create a lifestyle brand to express the value time possesses, so that people all around the world can take something from it. Time is what takes us through this journey.

Make it as inspiring as you can. 

 

 

THE APOLLO SERIES

Inspirited by the ingenuity that comes when people chase bold dreams, we created an Apollo-inspired concept to surround our collection. We want to effect the same type of inspiration that led us to the moon in the middle of the last century and reshaped how we see the world & ourselves.

Featuring three distinct colorways, we are proud to introduce our first line of unisex watches.

 

The Apollo Series

 

Apollo Vanta

Apollo Spade

Apollo Native

 

DESIGN

Simply put, we believe in pure craftsmanship at the highest level. The construction of each timepiece incorporates every aspect of precision, reliability, and functionality in mind. Each and every watch of ours is built with unrivaled Swiss Quartz Movement, Sapphire Crystal Glass, Premium Stainless Steel, & Genuine Leather.

 

Rose Gold

Azure Blue

Platinum Silver

 

We took the liberty of paying attention to all the little details in order to create you truly a one-of-a-kind product. With unique engravings throughout the caseback, crown, buckle, & strap in addition to an all custom molded case, steel markers, & triplex hands, The Apollo Series was created to stand out from the masses.

 

 

We designed these pieces for your everyday wardrobe. With Premium 316L Stainless Steel and High-Level Sapphire Crystal Glass integrated into every piece, these watches are scratch/water resistant enough to withstand the heavy rigors of daily use.

 

 

Just like fine wine, our straps get better with age. We chose to go with the finest genuine calf leather that will develop beautiful natural markings over time. This allows you to not only add another unique element to the look, but also an aesthetic persona that tells your story.

 

 

In the minimalist world, it's hard to tell the difference between one brand from another. With embossed engravements and logos designed throughout the entire timepiece, our product holds true to its original identity with an individuated uniqueness.

 

 

THE MODEL

Unlike most other manufacturers, we've implemented a direct-to-consumer business model that allows us to craft you a world-class product at only a fraction of the price. Traditional models involve countless middlemen with distributors and wholesalers that can inflate costs up to 1000%. We wanted to create the type of impact that would disrupt modern timepieces permanently.

We want you to relate and grow with our brand, so transparency is key. Why pay for a 10x markup when you can have a watch on the cornerstone of the highest quality shipped directly to you for under $100. No ridiculous margins. No disconnections. No discrepancies.

Just us-to-you.

 

 

PRODUCTION SCHEDULE

FEBRUARY-MARCH: Production Begins
APRIL: Final Quality Control
MAY: Finalize Packaging
JUNE: Shipments Begin

For the better part of the last two years, we tirelessly sourced for a manufacturer who is able to execute our minimal, yet durable designs. The goal was to find an optimal partner that could accomplish precision with the finest materials without sacrificing our foundation of simplicity.

After building countless prototypes, we finally achieved one that fully meets our standards and are now ready for mass production. Our hope is that each timepiece holds true to it's authenticity, while guaranteeing to last a lifetime.

 

 

SIGNATURE ATLAS BRACELET

Our signature genuine leather bracelet included w/ each Apollo Series Timepiece.

 

ABOUT US

Hi there! We love watches. We're sure you do too. As former San Jose State University students brought up in a crazy startup ecosystem, we wanted to create some new and exciting without the technology fingerprints of Silicon Valley.

Taking everything that we've learned in the past few years at high-tech and manufacturing companies, we hope to bring a meaningful and refreshing change for all.
You can count on us to bring you a one-of-a-kind product.
Thanks for the love!

Talk to us!
danny@atlastime.co
auden@atlastime.co

 

CONTACT US

Have a question? Feel free to send any messages to our team at support@atlastime.co!

www.atlastime.co
www.faceboook.com/atlastime.co
www.instagram.com/atlastime.co
www.twitter.com/atlastime.co

story:
Specifications & Summary

 

Materials:

  • Leather Grain: Full Grain 
  • Sourced From: Florence, Italy
  • Type: Premium Italian Leather
  • Inner Lining: Microfiber lining

 

Main Features:

  • Recessed camera
  • Microfiber lining
  • Creaseless perimeter
  • Open access charging port and speaker holes
  • Open access lock button
  • Indented volume buttons
  • Easy clip-on/off edging
  • Screen protector compatible
  • Bump protection
  • Scratch/scuff protection
  • Dust protection
  • Grease protection
  • Natural grip
  • Stitchless
  • Logo free
  • Minimalist profile
  • Developing patina

 

Dimensions

Every Case:

  • Raised camera edging: 1.1mm
  • Raised screen edging: 1.1mm

iPhone 11 Luxe:

  • Dimensions: 16.2 x 8.3 x 1.2cm, 
  • Weight: Approx. 20g

iPhone 11 Pro Luxe:

  • Dimensions: 14.8 x 7.8 x 1.2cm
  • Weight: Approx. 20g

iPhone 11 Pro Max Luxe:

  • Dimensions: 15.5 x 8.1 x 1.2cm
  • Weight: Approx. 22g

iPhone X/XS Luxe:

  • Dimensions: 18.3 x 9.1 x 1.9cm
  • Weight: Approx. 20g

iPhone XR Luxe:

  • Dimensions: 17.4 x 9.6 x 1.8cm
  • Weight: Approx. 20g

iPhone XS Max:

  • Dimensions: 19.7 x 9.8 x 1.9cm
  • Weight: Approx. 22g

 

    Frequently Asked Questions

     

    Q: Is this the only colour offered?

    A: Should demand rise, there is potential for a stretch reward colour to be introduced.

    Q: What are the dimensions? How big is this feature?

    A: Please see the specifications above for a detailed breakdown of the features and dimensions.

    Q: How much does shipping cost to my country?

    A: We provide free shipping to all countries in the world. 

    Q: I have another question that isn't answered here, how can I contact you?

    A: You may contact us via the following channels and we will do our best to reply to you within the hour:

    - The Indiegogo messaging system

    - Through the Indiegogo comments - if you’re a backer

    - By email at: cs@filippomorato.com

story:
ABOUT...

We thought of Shake A Date 14 months ago as we wanted to create a fun way for singles to meet and interact, and come away from the old fahsioned way of long, boring compatibility questionairres and leave love in the hands of fate! We set about raising funds to pay a development company to build the first version of the app for us, and launched 5 months later in March 2012. Since then we have built up a customer base of over 12,000 members purely through free social media marketing. We need to build the next version of the app plus a fully functioning web version that will have a 'premium account' option for our members to upgrade. This next build is vital to keeping our dream alive as we need a revenue stream to keep the project going. We have literally put everything into this so far and would love to have the opportunity to take it to the next level!

 

HOW IT CURRENTLY WORKS...

Search for the person you want to find by choosing their Gender, Age Range and either Current Country and Current City or, GPS which will find the people closest to you within a chosen mile radius.

Once you've entered their criteria start the fun by shaking your iPhone (iPod or iPad) you'll then randomly find someone matching the criteria you entered. If you’re not feeling them simply keep shaking until you find someone you like.

When you find someone you like you can start chatting to them, or if you’re feeling shy and want them to 'make the move' then send them a 'Like' and let nature shake its course.

 

 

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE SPENT (NEW DEVELOPMENT)

The £17,000 we need to raise will cover the developemnt costs for a version 2 of the Shake A Date app and for the build of a fully functioning website that will work on the same basis as the app.

Version 2 of the app will be developed with a premium account built in, which will include Video & Voice chat through the users iPhone system. This development will cost £9,000

A whole new website will be built with the with the same features as the app but will have slightly different functionality to suit web. This development will cost £11,000

The development company we are using for this project are Blue Storm Solutions

http://www.bluestormsolutions.co.uk/

 

PERKS...


Some of the unique perks you can trigger with your donate to us are...

 

  • Add your name and/or your companies name to our contributors list on our main website.
  • Free 1 year, 2 year and lifetime memberships to Shake A Date.
  • Public recognition on our Social Media outlets, Facebook & Twitter
  • Free membership to all future apps/websites created by us
  • Become an official Shake A Date beta tester, where you will be the first to test our future releases and provide us with all your feedback and ideas on improvement.
  • V.I.P guest at our launch party!
  • Be one of the faces on the home page of our brand new website that your donations will fund.
  • FREE advertising for 1 year on our brand new website.

 

Thank you for taking time to check us out, we would be massivelly appreciative to all that donate and would love to take Shake A Date to the next level with all you lovely contributors and have your name etched onto our website for eternity!

story:
So Basically...

I realize the irony of being a webcam model and relying on technology for a living when I have never had a phone that does more that make calls and send texts. However, with my personal increased need to keep up to date on all of my social media sites, as well as providing more outlets for communication with my viewers/followers (i.e. Kik, Snapchat, etc) I feel it is the time to finally own a SmartPhone and have an easier time managing all of my commitments right now. The hope is to also begin a new plan, off of my family's plan for the sake of feeling more comfortable with what I send and who I talk to.

What I Need...

I know a goal of $500 is a bit steep, but here is my thought process: I am hoping to get an Android (sorry Apple lover, no offense I swear!) that will hopefully be under $300. The plan I am looking at currently (although this is tentative to change) will be around $45 so the rest is just to help me going on the first few bills just to help me budget myself with adding this to the list of all of the other bills.

Why you should help...

Again, as aforementioned, social media:
* Better updating my Tumblr which I know has been lacking but is my pride and joy of social media right now
*Staying up to date on all new Tweets, follows, PMs, etc.
*Hopefully aiding in what I would like to become a sex toy review blog/vlog (a project I have wanted to do for a while now.)
As well as new things that could be offered!
*Snapchat (I've never even been able to take remotely decent photos on any of my phones before so this is big for me.)
*Kik: Which I hope will be easier than DMing on Twitter
*Possibly partaking in phone sex as a side offer/business
And, well, for things more personal to me, such as Tinder. I have met some lovely girls on there but since I can only check on Othello's phone and he's never home, well, I'm being rather twat blocked. Even sending/accepting photos is a luxury I have lacked. I can't even sext Othello while he's gone.

Again, as aforementioned, social media:* Better updating my Tumblr which I know has been lacking but is my pride and joy of social media right now*Staying up to date on all new Tweets, follows, PMs, etc.*Hopefully aiding in what I would like to become a sex toy review blog/vlog (a project I have wanted to do for a while now.)As well as new things that could be offered!*Snapchat (I've never even been able to take remotely decent photos on any of my phones before so this is big for me.)*Kik: Which I hope will be easier than DMing on Twitter*Possibly partaking in phone sex as a side offer/businessAnd, well, for things more personal to me, such as Tinder. I have met some lovely girls on there but since I can only check on Othello's phone and he's never home, well, I'm being rather twat blocked. Even sending/accepting photos is a luxury I have lacked. I can't even sext Othello while he's gone.

story:
Klikr is unlike any other consumer product in the market. It symbolizes style and class. We believe it  will change the way people capture, store and share their memories. 

Thanks to our growing number of backers from Canada, USA, Hong Kong, Mexico, Israel, United Kingdom, Greece, India, Singapore, Australia and Vietnam for generously supporting Klikr. 

Join Us !!!!!in bringing klikr to the market.

Introducing Klikr

Klikr is a cutting edge modular case, for iPhone 6, iPhone 6s and Samsung S6. It has a built-in 16 megapixel robotic camera that is fully detachable. Klikr comes equipped with a smart selfie stick, a 2400mAh battery for extra juice and a super cool Magnetic charging system.


Klikr has a ground breaking user interface with an elegant design. Klikr was crafted with only one thing in mind, to reinvent the camera and revolutionize the entire photo taking experience. 

Klikr boasts extremely advanced micro-robotic technology with sophisticated circuitry that creates a seamless photo taking experience.

A built-in selfie stick provides up to 2 feet of extension for perfect group or individual selfies.  


The klikr camera, is the smallest action camera available in the market. When detached and laid horizontally, the selfie stick acts as a stable motorized base for the camera, making it the most advanced robotic camera system, that can be wirelessly controlled from a distance of more than 10 feet.


The wand and the camera has its own battery that makes it a fully functional action camera. The camera connects with every smartphone via WiFi and Bluetooth.

"Klikr Karry"  makes Klikr camera the smallest action camera for capturing those memorable and adventurous moments and works with every go-pro and other existing mount bases.


Klikr has a built-in 2400 mAh battery, that doubles your phones battery life. 
Klikr also comes in just the battery pack, for those who like to keep the Wand and Camera separate from the case. The klikr battery pack case has a 2400 mAh battery that gives an additional 24 hours of standby time.

Another thing that makes klikr a really futuristic gadget is its magnetic charging system, that charges the whole system simultaneously.

Klikr is fully modular. You can have the wand and the camera separate, the klikr battery pack case (without the wand and camera) or the full klikr experience. 


Klikr is built upon a groundbreaking media and photo sharing app. We are introducing for the first time ever, a Zero-Click share mechanism that sets new standards in user experience. Kapchaa lets you capture, share and organize your memories all from the same app.


Kapchaa has a built-in lock feature that lets you simply drag and drop your photo in a password secured folder for absolute privacy.

We spent a lot of time building something that is truly revolutionary. Klikr has inside in it, highly sophisticated and compact robotic technology, that needs expensive tooling for manufacturing. We want to be transparent on how we spend the funds from our supporters. Below is a projection of how the funds will be spent. 


OUR TEAM: We are a small but talented team with years of technology experience in our bags. 
The Genius (Saad A)- When he’s not busy at the office, he can be found at a golf course working on his game. 
The Troublemaker (Ray S)- Outside of work, Ray’s interest vary from video games to reading comics, and sometimes traveling. 
Marketing Ninja (Anmol K)- Aside from marketing, Anmol loves cooking and claims to cook a mean lasagna. 
The Comic (Jazz S)- In his free time, Jazz loves playing guitar. You can also find him watching Jackie-chan’s movies.  
The Design Guru (Addy Z)- Apart from designing, Addy can be found with his telescope, looking at the sky, while enjoying a glass of wine with a cigar. 

Klikr is a groundbreaking idea, and we believe it will revolutionize the way people capture moments. But we’re a young start up and we need your support. All it takes right now is a pledge on Indiegogo.


Please help us spread the word via the [Share this project] button , at the bottom of this page. 

 Please Like and share us on Facebook: Klikr



Risks and challenges

With a product that is highly sophisticated with very intricate tiny parts, the main challenge is quality control. Thus, we have gone through great lengths to choose our manufacturing and supply partners very carefully, to ensure they are well equipped to handle a project of this magnitude. Another challenge is the size of our order. With a larger order, the cost will reduce due to economies of sale, however, the manufacturing lead time might increase. That is a balance we will have to monitor very closely to avoid delays in the shipping schedule. In all circumstances we will keep our backers posted and in the loop, as we understand the importance of communication. More importantly, we really want to share this entire experience with our backers

story:
Quick look at the lucid map - completely colored by users according to their own feelings - and you know what to expect at places you're unfamiliar with.
Tell people how safe is your neighborhood!
Travel? Warn others against the shady places you stumbled upon. 
 

Start with


I bet you have a problem with getting to know how safe a specific area is. Suspense, choosing longer route, even giving up a meeting... yeah, we know these.
But never again. Please meet SafeThru.

We built the tool that collects how safe users feel, combines these opinions and serves it to you as a colorful map. You don’t need to browse forums, ask people and dig through different opinions. Just look at the map and you immediately recognize  a dangerous and safe spots.

No crime reports. No police reports. No official reports at all.
Only the opinions from people who live there, who have ever been there.


And you know what? If you visit a new place we want you to stay safe.
Say Hello  to our feature.



We need your help

So far all our actions have been bootstrapped. But it is high time to go to the next level.

Collected money will allow us to maintain all IT infrastructure. Right now we spread safety info for free and want to keep on doing so. 

The map. Currently only Europe and North America are available in our application. Let people from the whole world feel safe!

To develop more features e.g offline mode. You can read about all of them below.

And finally the iOS version of application.


What else is to do?

Offline maps

Download an interesting map's section to your device and use it when you are offline. Very useful when traveling and you don’t have Internet access or  it is expensive.

Safe routes

Select your route clear of dangerous areas. This function evaluates safety of a chosen path and helps you make a decision related to your way. It's like an  intelligent navigation which suggests you destination by safest route.

Alarming the closest

Be notified every time your closest is exposed to danger. You will get the message with details about area and coordinates of place where he/she is. 

I am in a danger

Call for help. If you feel that something bad may happen to you, simply press a button. Your device will turn into alarming siren and draw attention to you.



Want to know more?

The results from our survey show that people want to have an easy access to this kind of information. And, what is more important, majority of them would share their knowledge with others.








Application



First screen was designed for quick check on map of the area that you need. That gives you general picture of situation. Buttons in corners give you access to most useful functions.



Second screen allows to rate areas in sense of safety. By one finger move you can mark the areas you know and share this with the rest of the word.


Final word

I want you to share this campaign in your network.

We're running a referral contest within our campaign!

Log into Indiegogo and share the information about this campaign using the site's share features.  The person whose referrals generate the most contributions will get Premium account for a whole year!  Indiegogo can track the contribution  share referral only for logged user. That is why you have to be logged in to participate in contest. Good luck!


Additional goals:

If we get 200% of amount, iOS version will be developed.




After that, we are planing to adapt the application to smart watches.




FAQ:

1. What does it mean that some place is marked with an actual color?
Colors match sense of safety marked by people. From clear green (the safest) to clear red (the most dangerous).

2. On what basis should I mark places?
Every time you are/were at (or simply know about) a place which for you seems dangerous you a have chance to spread this info all over the word. Same thing with safe places.

3. Can I mark area with different color than it is marked at the moment?
Yes, in fact this is what SafeThre is all about, anyone can have own opinion.

4. I don't have Android device. Can I use SafeThru?
At this moment no, but if campaign will be realized in 200% iOS version will be developed.

5. If I want to check or mark some place do I have to register an account?
Yes, the account registration is required.

6. Where can I find instruction for this app?
You can get the instruction at www.safethru.com/tutorial.pdf

7. Is SafeThru powered by some data from police reports or any other sources?
SafeThru does not use data from police or any other publicly available sources. SafeThru represents sense of safety in regard to individual users' opinions.





Meet the team


Maciej Dudek
This project is his brainchild. Maciej is the main and (currently) the only developer of SafeThru.


Maciek Kupidura
Maciej is passionated about graphic design. When he found out about this idea he immediately believed in it and noticed value for many people. Everything you can see in SafeThru is of his design.


Mateusz Piwowarczyk
Mateusz is an engineer but it turns out that for him more fun is doing more right-brained things. That is why in project he's involved with marketing and bussines development. Technical experience is also useful for example for finding details which could not be found in regular work with application.
